Seeing the floor quickly approaching, he shut his eyes and braced for impact. Strangely, he could have sworn he saw James flash in front of his eyes before he shut them.

You watched in terror as Allen’s entire body fell toward you. His chest was right above you and seemed to drop in slow motion. It was too late to do anything.

“Wait--”

*SLAAAAM*

Allen hit the floor of James’ room hard. He thought he heard something crunch under him, but dismissed it and only stood up while rubbing is forehead which hit the floor.

“Well, I know now he’s a slob…” muttered Allen under his breath. He took one last look around the room to acknowledge that James was not there. He then left quietly, completely unaware of the small splotch of blood on his Exorcist coat. Only a half hour later did someone point it out to him in the hall, but he only though he had fallen on a bug or some kind of leftovers. The coat was discarded into the laundry when Allen took his next shower, the blood washed off like any other stain. The only other evidence of your being, a small blood stain on the floor of your room, was mopped up soon afterwards when you were declared to have defected.
1213.title: Shortest Black Order Membership Ever

13.content:
You’re cold and naked. Your limbs are strapped down to a plate, forcing you to remain in place. The room you’re in is dark, you can only make out a few feet around you. Within that field of vision was a giant Soul Eater. The white-haired boy gazed down at you hungrily. He was starving, and you were lunch. Bringing his handsome face foreword, he breathed hot air over your skin to warm you up. You weren’t scared and you didn’t struggle; you wanted this. Soul’s lips parted and his slick tongue crept out. He dragged the pink muscle across your small form, from your crotch to your face. You moaned as you were covered in his saliva, feeling yourself harden. The giant teen above you chuckled evilly and licked him lips. The last thing you saw was Soul’s gapping mouth, lined with his razor-like teeth, lunge toward you and engulf you in darkness. Your screams couldn’t pierce the darkness and they carried over from the realm of sleep to the real world.

You woke up in a cold sweat. Your name was Lewis and you were 16-years-old. You cursed as you smothered your face with your hands. What was wrong with you? Monday you were stepped on by Kid. Tuesday you were sat on by Black Star. And now you were eaten by Soul. The dreams of your favorite anime characters aroused you, yet you woke up screaming in terror. You felt the wetness in your pants and carried yourself over to the bathroom to wash up before going back to sleep.

The rest of the night goes without incident. You wake up to find your parents have already left for work, so you fix yourself some breakfast and get ready for school. There are no bus routes around your area, so you’re forced to walk several miles to school everyday. You don’t mind it very much, as the exercise keeps your body in shape. You arrive at school and make it through the next seven hours of torture. Torture filled with boring lessons, annoying bullies, and horrible cafeteria food. Nonetheless, you leave the building with a few good test grades and another night’s worth of homework.

Man, your life is so dull. It’s as if your dreams are the only excitement you get…even though they irritate you.

On your way home, your usual path is obstructed by a traffic accident, forcing you to take an alternate route though a plaza of odd shops. One of the shops catches your eye: a magic shop. You aren’t really saving the little allowance you get for anything in particular, so you decide to see if there’s any little trinket you can get. You walk though the glass door and scan through the many jewels, emblems, rings, and other hocus-pocus. One item attracts your attention: a talisman with a moon-shaped crystal imbedded into it. Without thinking, you take it off the rack and examine it in your hands. Not three seconds later, the shop owner begins shouting at you.

“Hey, ya little punk! Can’t you read the signs?! Don’t touch the merchandise without permission!!” screamed the grumpy old man. You clumsily put the item back and apologize.

“Um…how much is it?” you ask the owner. The man grumbles under his breath before asking.

“Eight bucks. Would have been five, but then ya touched it!”

You sigh and decide to buy it anyway, not wanting to make the man any angrier. Before leaving with your purchase, you turn back to the man.

“What does it do?”

“Do? It…um…makes your dreams come true. Yeah, now get lost.”

You roll your eyes and leave. Just another piece of junk to put in your room.

The remainder of the day goes on like always until it’s night again. The talisman is thrown carelessly on your desk and you lay down on your bed, looking out the window.

“Makes my dreams come true…ha. More like nightmares.” you mumble to yourself before falling asleep, unknowing of the drastic changes you’ve made to your fate.

The first thing you notice when you wake up is the feeling of your bed. It’s different yet familiar. It also smells like feet. You open your eyes to see white material with some dark stains instead of your normal bed. It looks like…a giant sock? You bold upright and look over the sock.

“What the hell? Is this another dream? No…I can feel the sock…this is real.”

You itch your skin from it being irritated by the rough cotton of the sock and look around. Your vision isn’t completely clear yet, but you can make out random objects. A chair, a window, a door, a bed…all giant sized. You couldn’t be more than three inches tall. As everything became less hazy, you noticed you weren’t alone. Lying on the bed was the owner of this room and the sock you’re on…
13.title: Soul Eater

choices: You make it to the top and attempt to wake Black Star
You can't make it and slide back down to the floor to think of another plan
132.content:
No...freaking...way...

Not only were you shrunken to three inches tall but somehow you've managed to get transported into the world of the anime Soul Eater! That's just...not possible...and yet there was a giant Black Star laying on the bed above you! You knew it was him from his spiky blue hair and the star tattoo on his right arm. From your angle you couldn't tell if he was awake or asleep and judging by the light outside it was either dusk or dawn. Looking around you notice there's no clocks in his room at all, not even an alarm clock of some kind. Evidently Tsubaki woke him up every morning.

You sit down and decide to try and figure out what's going on. Something made you shrink and transported you into another world, that much was obvious. This was also dangerously close to the dreams you've been having recently about Black Star, Soul Eater, and Death the Kid. You smack yourself in the head. That talisman actually worked. You doubt that crotchety old man even knew he had a genuine magic charm on his hands. Then again it's entirely possible he knew all along and expected this. But that's ridiculous. Things like that only happened in movies and comic books. The fact of the matter was, you were tiny, naked, and trapped in a foreign world. The best thing to do would be to get help. Since Black Star is the only thing around here that could possibly help you, you decide to try and contact him.

Of course, this is easier said then done. You're not sure what it is that Black Star is doing up on his bed due to the angle but he hasn't moved for awhile. He's either really deep in thought or else he's sleeping. Judging from Black Star's personality you're going to assume he's sleeping. Unfortunately this meant that the only way you were going to get his help is to wake him up. The only way you were going to be able to wake him up is by climbing the sheets and actually physically attempt to wake him up. This would be a lot easier if he actually had a Japanese style bed which would be much closer to the ground. Come to think of it, why didn't he have a bed like that? You're not sure where exactly Death City is but since this is anime it makes sense that it would be Japanese styled right? You can't remember if they ever actually showed Black Star's room before so you can't ascertain whether or not he has a western style bed or a Japanese style one. Since the talisman did bring your dreams to life as it were and since you've can't remember seeing Black Star's room it's possible that your mind just filled in the blanks with something you were familiar with. Regardless, this is all very far from the point of what you're trying to accomplish.

It doesn't take long to reach the edge of the bed and luckily for you the sheets are hanging down low enough for you to climb. Grabbing the material in both hands you begin your climb up the side of the bed.
132.title: Ruminations and Rising Action

1321.content:
The trek up the bed was hard, and a few times you thought you were going to fall, but eventually you made it to the top. After taking a quick breather, you looked up and gasped. Sure, he looked giant from the floor, but up close he was just unbelievable. You couldn’t admire him for very long, though, as that snoring was very irritating and you had to get him up. For your first attempt at this ridicules task, you walked over to the forest of his blue hair, grabbed as much of it as you could, and pulled. You pulled with all your might, but the giant meister never stirred. After a few minutes, if by your tugging or not, Black Star turned over onto his belly. With your hands still grasping his hair, you were pulled up and became entangled in the hair. It took a full six minutes until you were free and threw yourself onto the boy’s back.

While the giant continued to snore into his pillow, you tried jumping on his back. It felt like solid stone under your feet while Black Star didn’t feel a thing. Not giving up, you tried the same thing to the back of his neck. It was more sensitive here and the giant boy reached a hand up to itch the spot. You saw the giant digits coming and jumped off of him before the nails dug into his flesh to scratch it. You were still in hot water as Black Star’s restless sleeping habits flipped him over again. This time his back was aimed on being on top of you. Not wanting to be squashed flat like in your dreams, you ran for you life as the gigantic mass approached. You just managed to escape the shadow as Black Star’s muscular form sunk back into the bed.

He wasn’t even awake and he was dangerous! You couldn’t believe someone as energetic as him was a heavy sleeper. You had to put and end to this, and you hoped the third time was the charm. Running over to his ear, you did the last thing you could think of: yelled. You yelled his name with everything you had.
1321.title: Now for the Hard Part

choices: He decides he was dreaming the voice.
13211.content:
When you finally ceased your yelling, you dropped to your knees and gasped for air. At the same time, the giant in front of you began to stir and grunt. His eyes flickered open and he slowly leaned up from his laying position. To you it was like a god awaking from his long slumber. The blue-haired teen rubbed his eyes while muttering something about Tsubaki. Apparently, he thought it was his partner that had woken him up. When he was able to see clearly, he took notice that there wasn’t anyone else in the room…or at least no one he could see right away. This wasn’t good; he could get up and leave without even noticing you. After all that work, you prayed he’d notice you.

“That’s strange. I thought someone woke me up.” muttered the weapon meister. His eyes drifted across the room until eventually…
13211.title: Black Star wakes up

choices: Morning comes and Black Star forgot about you, putting on the sock you're in!
Morning comes and Black Star takes you to school
132111.content:
Still trying to catch your breath, you watch as Black Star's sleepy eyes slowly scan the room, looking for the source of the noise he had heard. In a last ditch attempt at getting him to notice you you jump up and wave your arms around. The tiny movement is not lost on Black Star and his eyes fall directly onto you. He brought his face closer to you and you instinctively step back. Having someone that large suddenly focus all his attention on you made you feel anxious. You know that you need help to survive in this world until you find a way back to your own but you can't help but feel intimidated by Black Star's frowning, quizzical face. He studies you for a moment until he figures out what you are.

"Are you...some kind of bug or something?"

Your face falls as you hear him say that. To a lot of teenage boys bugs are only good for one thing and you'd rather not travel down the same path as in your dreams. You frantically shake your head hoping he sees the slight movement. He does because he grabs you and brings you to his face. The sudden movement is dizzying and you fall over on his palm. He brings his other hand up and pokes you lightly. Of course, lightly to a powerful teen like Black Star was a rather forceful shove to you, forcing you onto your back. He brings you really close to his face, until you can feel his warm, slightly moist breath wash over your body. You can already feel your clothes moistening. His eyes suddenly widen as he exclaims, "You're a human! But a really tiny one."

You quickly get to your feet and nod emphatically. He smiles down at you and asks, "Are you a meister or a weapon? Or are you neither?"

You quickly explain your situation, realizing how crazy it sounds. Black Star listens and nods occasionally as you tell your story. When you finished he said, "Wow, that's pretty crazy. Lucky for you a big guy like me was around to help you. With me on your side you'll get back home in no time!"

Having seen Soul Eater in its entirety you know that Black Star is enthusiastic and will do anything to protect his friends, but he's also a bit of a over eager show off. But you don't want to complain, especially after he so willingly decided to help you. Black Star tosses the covers off his body and stands up. You suddenly realize he's wearing nothing but his boxers, his hard muscular body almost entirely visible to you. You can't help but admire his physique. He catches you looking and grins. "Impressive isn't it?"

You nod and he laughs at you. "Yeah, being around me can be pretty intimidating I know!"

He walks over to his dresser and pulls out a loose sock. "I know this isn't much, but it's the best I can for now for a bed for you. When morning comes I'll take you to Shibusen. Lord Shinigami will be able to help you I'm sure."

He laid the sock out on his dresser top and set you down on top of it. It smells forcibly of Black Star's feet but it's a bit chilly and beggars can't be choosers so you opened the lip of the sock and scooted inside. You hear Black Star lay back down on his bed and within minutes he's snoring again. You sigh and close your eyes, sleep coming eventually to your exhausted body.
132111.title: All That Effort Paid Off

choices: Black Star gets to class without interruption.
He meets Soul outside the school.
1321111.content:
For a smelly, obviously unwashed sock of Black Star’s, you actually got a good night’s sleep. Something you didn’t get much thanks to those dreams. Eventually morning came over Death City and Black Star woke up. It only took a yawn and a few eye rubs before the energetic meister was wide awake and ready for the new day.

“Wow, that was a crazy dream.” he said to himself. “There was a little tiny dude and he wanted my help. I put him in--” Black Star trailed off as he glanced at his clock. “SHIT!! I’m going to be late! Why didn’t Tsubaki wake me up?!” Black Star sprung out of bed and quickly slipped on his usual attire. He put on one of his socks, but couldn’t find the other. “Damnit, where is it?” He looked atop his dresser to find his missing sock…the same one you currently slept in. Completely disregarding his dream, he snatched up the sock.

Your sleep was rudely interrupted as you tumbled to the bottom of the sock. You were still half-asleep and tried to collect your thoughts. You barely managed to before everything got dark and you looked up to see a giant bare foot entering the sock. You became overcome with fear and tried to run, but there was no place to go. Soon the wall of flesh that was the meister’s foot fell upon you and pinned you against the sock. Your entire body was under his sole, save for you head which peaked out from between his toes. What was going on? Had Black Star forgotten the events of last night? Or…had he fooled you!

You didn’t have much time to ponder the question, as Black Star put his shoes over his socked feet and dashed out the door. You felt every step he took, his powerful body crushing you into his sole without notice. At first it was painful, but gradually got better as you got used to the pressure. You just hopped Black Star wouldn’t stomp down or anything, or else your dreams would be reality.
1321111.title: This is no Dream

choices: Black Star feels something in his shoe
Black Star and Soul are up to something...
13211112.content:
After what felt like a few endless minutes of constant numbing pounding on your body your tumbling world comes to an abrupt stop as Black Star stops running. Your dazed mind wonders what's going on when you hear a familiar voice. It's Soul! Black Star must have stopped running to talk to Soul. You strain your ears to listen to their conversation, their voices muffled by sock and shoe.

"Hey Soul, what are you doing outside? You're going to be late too!"

Soul snorted and said, "There's no way I'm going in there! Maka's on the warpath since she barely got any time to study last night. I didn't study at all so I'm skipping today. I'll tell Sid-sensei that I was sick or something."

"No way he's going to buy that!" Black Star laughed.

"It's better than going in and failing, which is exactly what's going to happen to you if you go in there!" Soul replied scathingly.

Black Star stopped laughing and said, "Good point. Think Sid-sensei will buy me being sick too?"

Soul shrugged and said, "If we're going to get in trouble we might as well get in trouble together."

With that statement the study pressure on your body increased as Black Star continued walking. Your mind started wandering as Black Star and Soul walked through Death City. This whole surreal trip had all the makings of one of your dreams, sans the immediate death. You remember your dream of the previous night, the giant Soul eating you alive, your tiny body nothing more than a lump traveling down his throat before landing in his belly. Of course, you woke up before things got that far. You shiver as you realize that the man responsible for your death in a dream is walking with another guy who had killed you another night by sitting on you! All you needed was for them to run into Death the Kidd and you'd be surrounded by a trifecta of possible death. Of course, he would never skip class like the other two boys. But then again just last night you had talked with Black Star and he was completely nice and understanding. Perhaps purposeful death was something you didn't have to worry about. Then again, you could easily get turned into jelly by accident any second now.

Your mind was so laden with these kinds of thoughts that you didn't realize Black Star had stopped walking. Why did he stop?
13211112.title: Skipping Class

choices: "No way, man. I'm not getting bug guts all over my foot!"
132111121.content:
As Black Star walked through the city, he felt a foreign object pressed against his foot. He tried kicking it out of place, but it wouldn’t budge. You got shook up quite a bit, though. Getting annoyed at the object, he stopped walking in order to take care of this little problem first. Soul stopped a few moments after he noticed his friend stop and turned to look at him.

“What’s the matter?” the white-haired teen asked as Black Star looked at his shoe with an irritated face.

“There’s something in my shoe.” he answered simply. Soul rolled is eyes.

“How horrible. Whatever shall we do now that there’s a pebble in your shoe?”

“Don’t be a dickhead.” Black Star spat as he continued to play with the object with his toes. “Besides, I think it’s alive. I feel it squirming.”

Inside the shoe, the giant’s toes were giving you a very uncomfortable body massage. You were relieved, however. Both that you’ve been noticed and that Black Star hadn’t actually betrayed you. He’d just forgotten he had put you in his sock. His stupidity still made you angry, though. Anger and relief was soon replaced by fear and dread, though, as the other giant spoke up.

“It must be a bug or something. Just squish it.”

Nononononono! Stupid, stupid Soul! Why did you have to go and say that?! But there was nothing you could do under the tremendous foot of the Star Clan ninja. You just waited for his response and your fate.
132111121.title: The Bug and the Foot

choices: Black Star recognizes you. You're saved!
Black Star just sees a funny bug. Adieu cruel world!
1321111211.content:
This was it. The moment you dreaded happening was actually going to happen. You were going to be crushed into paste, trodden on until your body exploded like a grape all because of the oblivious of a teen from another world. You wondered if Black Star would notice your remains and identify them with the tiny human he thought was a dream or if you'd be too crushed to distinguish. Or perhaps he would just promptly forget about you and wash your remains off in the shower. These thoughts were going nothing to ease the troubled beating of your heart but you couldn't help thinking them. You were about to have the life crushed out of you after all, you were allowed to be distressed about it.

Of course, as these thoughts raced through your head, Black Star hadn't even made a move to increase pressure.

"No way, man! I'm not getting bug guts all over my foot!" Black Star said, annoyance clear in his voice.

You feel an immense relief swelling up inside you. You weren't going to die! Black Star wasn't going to crush you after all! Maybe he wasn't so stupid after--

"I'll dump it on the ground and crush it with my shoe!"

Goddammit.

Well, it looked like the end of the line for you after all. After all the anguish you felt a few seconds ago, followed the by the immense relief, you were left feeling nothing but numbness. Apparently this was what all your dreams had been warning you about. You couldn't but bitterly think what kind of warning this was when you didn't even know getting transported to another world was possible. You felt Black Star lift his socked foot out of the shoe and felt yourself falling against his foot as he stood on one leg to take off his sock. Once the sock was removed he went to put his foot down again. Thinking fast, you manage to pull yourself on top of his toes so that his foot isn't crushing down on you. You look up and see both Black Star and Soul looking down at you with smiles on their faces, ready to crush the "bug" that was bothering Black Star. Well, this is your last chance at survival. If this doesn't work then you'll be as good as dead.

You quickly get to your feet and jump up and down, waving your arms and calling out their names, trying to do anything and everything that would identify you as a tiny human and not a little bug. You can only pray that you're successful.
1321111211.title: Just When You Thought It Was Safe...

choices: You're still pissed at Black Star.
13211112111.content:
When the tiny “bug” starting jumping around and making funny noises, Black Star just brushed it off as a feeble attempt at begging for mercy. But as he focused more on the tiny being, a familiar shape started to form in his mind. One that wasn’t a gross bug but a…

“Oh shit!” shouted Black Star, just loud enough so a few people gave them odd glances. Soul was startled by his friend’s outburst and jumped back.

“Whoa, what is it? Did it scare you or something?”

Black Star gave Soul a glare. Him being scared of a bug? Ha! But that wasn’t important right now. “Take a closer look.”

Soul shrugged and crouched down to get a better look at the thing on Black Star’s foot. His resulting face was almost and exact copy of Black Star’s. “Dude, there’s a tiny human on your foot!”

The weapon meister didn’t know where to start first. The fact that Soul was stating the obvious or that he had unknowingly wore a sock with a tiny person in it. Not just any person, but the same person from his dream! Actually, that didn’t seem like a dream anymore…

“It’s Lewis, right? Crap, I’m really sorry little guy.” he apologized before gently picking you up and allowing you to rest on his palm. Soul walked up to his friend’s side for a closer look.

“Do you know this squirt, Black Star?” asked the weapon. Black Star nodded in response.

“His name’s Lewis. He appeared in my room last night and I agreed to help him. I put him in my sock to sleep and then…”

“…forgot about him?” Soul raised an eyebrow. Black Star chuckled nervously and looked away from you in embarrassment. Soul sighed. “Man, you’re an idiot, you know that?”

Black Star didn’t bother retaliating. He was a bit worried about you and how you were doing. “Are you okay, little guy? I’m REALLY sorry.”

You looked up at the giant that held you. You were glad he’d found you, but still angry at him for forgetting about you in the first place. How dangerous was it going to be if you were in HIS possession. He probably wouldn’t hurt you…purposely. You thought about it for a few seconds before speaking up to the giant who just stared at you.
13211112111.title: To Forgive and Forget?

choices: Soul is curious about you and starts asking questions
Black Star goes the the bathroom leaving you with Soul for awhile
132111121111.content:
You had only just narrowly avoided death and as such of course you were angry at Black Star. Because of his carelessness you could have been ground into paste. The thought still sends a shiver down your spine. You had every right to be angry at him! Yet yelling your grievances at a guy who could unknowingly kill you might not be such a great idea. Get him mad and the stomping might not be accidental. Besides he's your only link to this world. If you yelled at him he might think you're more trouble than your worth and dump you off somewhere to try and fend for yourself.

Weighing all the pros and cons in your mind you realize there's no other choice beyond just forgiving Black Star and getting his help. You look up into his embarrassed face and said, "I forgive you!"

Black Star cracks a grin at you and responds by saying, "Alright! I knew you were a cool little guy! We're going to get along great together!"

Soul rolled his eyes and said, "If you and your little boyfriend are done can we get something to eat? I'm starving!"

Black Star simply dropped you into his shirt pocket and asked, "Are you jealous or something Soul?"

Soul snorted and replied, "As if!"

Sighing you lean back against Black Star's chest, the darkness of the pocket filtered slightly by incoming light. It was nice being in a warm place without having to worry about death pressing down on you. The smell was also considerably nicer. The beating of Black Star's heart combined with the slow motion of his body is enough to put you to sleep. You resist the urge to sleep however as you too are pretty hungry and don't want to be left out of the feasting.

In a few minutes the two boys reach a cafe and sit down at a table. Black Star pulls you out and sets you behind a salt shaker where Soul and him could see you but no one else could. A waiter comes to take their order, leaves, and returns a short time later with two drinks. After placing the drinks in front of the boys he told them, "Your meals will be here shortly." and left. Looks like you've got some time to kill.
132111121111.title: Forgive, Forget, and Eat

choices: He grabs you and hides you, then makes up some excuse to Black Star.
He was just scaring you...for now.
1321111211112.content:
Before Black Star’s drink even reached his lips, a loud gurgle came from his stomach and he grabbed it with his other hand.

“Urg. I knew those tacos last night were a bad idea.” he moaned as he put his drink down and got up from his seat. “Sorry guys, but nature calls. I have to empty out before filling up.” And with that the ninja meister was gone, rushing toward the bathroom and almost knocking over another table. Soul just diverted his eyes form the scene and drank from his glass. His crimson eyes drifted down to you, leaning against the salt and just waiting for Black Star to return. That muscle head didn’t know the fun he was missing out on. It’s not everyday you find a mini teenager in your room to do with as you wish, and Black Star chose to help the little guy. How boring. Soul continued to stare at you, who was turned away and gazing into the distance. A grin appeared on his face as he began to think up devious thoughts. If Black Star wanted to pass up this chance to be in control, that was his choice. Soul on the other hand…

The salt shaker you were leaning against disappeared as Soul moved it. You fell backwards and looked up in surprise. “Oops, sorry little guy. I was just making room for the food. Did I scare you?” You didn’t say anything and just shook your head. Soul was satisfied, but continued to look at you. “So tell me, Lewis. What do you think of Black Star?” You regained your composure and stood up while answering.

“He’s okay, I guess. He’s nice and said he’d help me.” you told the giant as he listened, smiling unusually. Soul closed his eyes and thought for a moment.

“That’s good.” he said with his eyes still closed. “Wouldn’t want to think about what would happen if you were with someone who wasn’t nice…” The white-haired teen cracked one of his red orbs open, which gazed at you. A glint of malevolence was present in it and it made you uncomfortable. “…and had no intention of helping at all.” Soul leaned down and his face got closer to you. You began to get a little scared and backed away, only to bump into the salt shaker that Soul had conveniently placed. Soul’s face as so close that you could probably touch it if you dared to. “That would be terrible, right?” Soul whispered, his hot breath washing over you and making you even more fearful. Both his eyes were open now and he smiled widely with sharp teeth so white you could see yourself in them. The next few seconds felt like hours as neither of you moved an inch, until finally Soul broke the tension.
1321111211112.title: Something Wicked this Way Comes...

choices: ...inside of Soul's shoe, underneath his unsocked bare foot.
...inside of Soul's underwear, pressed up against your new master's junk.
13211112111121.content:
Without warning, Soul quickly reaches for you and takes you into his hand. He holds you up to his face, his very large, shark-like grin stares you in the face as he speaks, "Well it's just your bad luck that I just don't happen to be all that nice." He then holds you closer to his gigantic, red eyes and speaks again, "Black Star will be back from the bathroom at any moment. Since you're going to be my new plaything, I need to make sure he thinks you just ditched him. So in the meantime, I need a place to keep you where you won't cause me trouble." He then lowers you down to... <insert choice here>.

When he had finished hiding you sufficiently, feeling you wriggling against him and enjoying his dominance over you, he saw Black Star return from the bathroom, "Oh man, that was rough. But nothing the great Black Star couldn't handle!" Soul then looked up at Black Star, with an irritated look on his face, "I'm sorry, Black Star. But that little guy you were taking care of. He started saying how he didn't want some weak and pathetic little kid taking care of him, and he managed to escape before I could catch him."

Black Star's attitude turned from leisurely joy to immense anger, "Who the hell does that little bug think he is!? If I knew he felt that way, I would have taken him into the bathroom with me and showed him who was truly the BIG man around here!" Soul just smiled and nodded, knowing that the lie worked perfectly as you were...
13211112111121.title: He grabs you and hides you, then makes up some ...

choices: Soul ditches Black*Star and has some fun with you
You spend all day under Soul's foot
132111121111211.content:
You struggled and shoved against the massive bare foot that was pressing down on you but it was totally pointless. Your arms were no match for even one of his toes let alone his whole foot. You situated under the appendage in such a way that your face was poking out between his big and second toe, the skin between the toes pressing against your chin. Your body was under extreme pressure as the sole of his foot and the ball of his foot pressed against your stomach and chest. It was hard to breath, not to mention the air was stifling hot and stale, your little lungs working hard to draw in any air. The stench of Soul's foot filled your nostrils, a smell of pure manly dominance that pushed against you and made you feel even more inferior. You truly were a bug and Soul could crush you as easily as anything. You laid, docile for now, underneath your new master's massive foot and just waited to see where this all ended up.

Soul, on the other hand, was having a great time. With every other step he took he could feel your body getting compressed under his sole. It made him feel huge and powerful, your whole life entirely in his hands. All it would take to end you would be slightly more pressure on his foot. A quick stomp and grind and you would be gone. The idea of having so much power over a human made him start getting hard. He laughed to himself.

"Now if only I had another one for my other foot I'd be in business..." he muttered to himself with a grin.

"What was that Soul?" Black*Star said, walking a few paces ahead of his friend.

"Never mind, I was just talking to myself." Soul said, hands in his pockets.

Black*Star laughed and said, "You shouldn't talk to yourself Soul! People are going to think you're nuts!"

Soul shrugged and said, "Why should I care what people think? A cool guy like me doesn't care about these uncool people."

"Yeah, I guess you're right." he replied, putting his arms behind his head. "I'm still feeling pretty pissed off about that kid though. I can't believe I let him stay with me so long!"

Soul chuckled and said, "Don't worry. I'm sure wherever he is he's getting what's coming to him!" He pressed down on you as he said this, his shark like grin firmly in place.
132111121111211.title: Pure Pressure

choices: Soul continues to toy with you.
1321111211112111.content:
The feeling of you struggling under his foot was giving Soul a rush. He just wanted to put you in his hands and do all kinds of things to you. Things you wouldn’t be able to prevent thanks to your minuscule size. However, as long as Black Star was around, Soul would never have the chance. He needed to ditch his friend somehow if he was going to have any fun with his new plaything.

“Hey, Soul, you feel like having a race?” Black Star asked, turning his head and smiling at Soul.

“Huh?” Soul raised an eyebrow at the sudden question. “Where did that come from so suddenly?”

“Come on, scrawny!” the meister shouted before he suddenly picked up pace and began running. “I’ll race you to the other side of town!”

“Hey, wait a minute!” Soul started running after the blue haired teen, but it was useless. With a shout of ‘yahoo!’ his friend disappeared in the distance. Soul sighed and scratched his head. Now he was going to have to chase after him…or did he? This was perfect! While Black Star ran to the other end of the city, he would head back home and be alone with you. Until the muscle head found out he had been ditched, you’d be all to himself. With a toothily grin, Soul put his hands back in his pockets and started walking the opposite way. “Sorry about this, Black Star. I found something else to amuse myself with.”

***

Soul strolled down the streets toward the apartment he shared with Maka. When he reached the building, he went inside and scaled the stairs to his floor.

“Almost home, little guy.” Soul muttered to you as he reached the floor his apartment room was on. He unlocked his door, went inside, and immediately headed for his bedroom. Once there, he sat down his bed and started removing his shoes. When both of his sweaty, bare feet were free he looked inside the shoe you were supposed to be in. To his surprise, you weren’t there. The albino teen started wonder if you escaped, but that was impossible! He felt you under his foot when he walked through the door. Wait…under his foot?

Soul quickly plopped one of his legs on his knee and checked his sole. Sure enough, there you were, stuck to his foot by his sweaty sole. Soul chuckled with amusement before peeling you off his foot and bringing you up to his face.

“Have a nice ride?” he asks, chuckling evilly.

“You jerk!” you yell, writhing wildly in his grip. “Bring me back to Black Star!”

“You want to go back to Black Star?” Soul asked as he laid down on his bed and held you above his face. “I don’t think that’s a good idea, kid. He looked like he was really pissed off at you when I left him. If he ever sees you again, it won’t be pretty.”

You glare hatefully at the giant demon weapon. Thanks to him, the one person you could trust thought you had used him. You might be able to convince Black Star that Soul was lying, but that wasn’t going to happen if you never see him again!

“What are you going to do to me?” you asked fearfully. Your fear makes Soul smirk widen.

“Honestly? I want to eat you. You look like you’d taste really good.” Soul licks his lips tauntingly and chuckles, blowing hot air your way. Even though his breath is warm, you shudder as if it was cold. “I guess I can’t do that, though. There’s only one of you and once you’re gone that’s it. I better use you as much as I can.”

With that said, Soul drops you onto his chest and you fall on your stomach. When you try to stand up again, Soul’s large hand comes down and presses you against his body. He takes pleasure in watching you struggle under his much larger hand as you attempt to free yourself. He has so much control over you and that control is intoxicating.
1321111211112111.title: Under Soul's Control

choices: Soul humiliates you under his foot
Soul's interupted by someone or something
13211112111121111.content:
Soul loved watching you struggle under his hand, pressed against the folds of his shirt. You could barely move let alone lift the hand off of you, not to mention that you were worn out from being trampled by Soul's sweaty foot. You had to suppress the need to shiver as you heard Soul's colossal heart beat rhythmically underneath you. Normally a sound of that nature would be soothing to you, but now all it reminded you of was the sound of tribal drums, bringing you closer to a sacrifice. Soul noticed you sweating and grinned, "You don't have to be worried you know...as long as you do exactly what I say!"

You looked up into his blood red eyes situated above his shark like grin and nodded slowly. You didn't trust yourself to speak right now. You were completely under Soul's control. In a...well, heartbeat, he could crush you flat against his shirt. He wouldn't even have to try. It would be a good idea NOT to piss him off. You were just going to have to wait until an opportunity arose to escape. There were a lot of sympathetic people in this world. Getting to them might be difficult, but staying with Soul was definitely out of the question. Suddenly, he grabbed the back of your shirt and lifted you into the air above his grinning face.

"Man, the more I look at you, the more I want to just eat you." A line of drool trickled down Soul's chin. He licked his lips and stuck out his tongue, dangling you above his cavernous maw, hot air blasting out at you in intervals. The huge pink muscle came out and ran over your body, starting at your feet and licking all the way up to your face. A few licks was all it took to get you completely drenched. Soul moaned a little, his eyes closed. "Wow...you really do taste good."

He brought you even lower, your feet and legs entering his mouth. You started struggling, fear evident on your face as you got dangerously close to those razor sharp teeth. Soul closed his lips over your lower half and began to slowly suck, savoring your taste. Your heart started to beat faster. This wasn't good. What is Soul suddenly decided you'd make a better snack than a toy? You could get sucked inside and then it would only be a short trip down his esophagus into his belly. You'd be melted down and then turned into nothing but fuel for the giant teen's body. Soul sucked on you for a few minutes before opening his mouth and pulling you back out.

"It's a shame there's only one of you." Soul said, looking disappointed. "It would be great to have a bunch of toys...some snacks...some sex toys..." He grinned as he said that last one. "Man...just having you in my hand like this, so pathetic and powerless, really gets me hard."

He dropped you on top of his jean clad bulge and pressed you against it. "You'd have your work cut out for you. Not only is my dick bigger than you, but I can get really horny. Pleasuring me is a full time job. You'll find that out soon enough though!"

He laughed and picked you back up, many more evil ideas running through his head as he looked you over.
13211112111121111.title: Learning Your Fate

choices: Soul sneaks into a Staff Only section to hide.
132111121111211112.content:
“Hmm…you know, you taste really good, but that’s just with your clothes on. I wonder how you’d taste with them off…” Soul grinned wickedly and slowly brought his other hand toward you. Your eyes widen as you think back to your dream. You were stripped naked in it…right before Soul ate you. What if he got a taste of your bare skin and it drove him over the edge? You might not leave his mouth this time…

Soul chuckles at your feeble attempts to wiggle out of his hand. He’s soon gripping the bottom of your shirt and slowly tugging it upward. As soon as your smooth stomach comes into view…

*Ring* *Ring* *Ring*

Saved by the phone.

“Ugh, who could be calling now? I’m supposed to be at school.” Soul mutters as he releases your shirt and hops out of bed. “I swear, if it’s Black Star…”

With you still in his hand, Soul walks out of his room and walks down the hall to the ringing phone. It’s just about to make its last ring when Soul picks it up and brings it to his ear.

“Hello?” he says, his tone showing slight irritation.

“Hello, this is Sarah Scarlet from Death City Library. I’m calling because our records show that a Soul Eater Evans borrowed a book from us three weeks ago. The title was…let me see…’Cooler Than Cool’ by Patrick Sten. It was due yesterday and we request you return it today to avoid a late fee.”

“That book…” Soul glances over at the living room table and spots said book lying facedown on it. “Oh, right. I’ll return it right now.”

“Thank you, we’ll be expecting you.” replied the woman before the line went dead and Soul placed the phone back on the receiver.

“Looks like we’re heading back out, little man.” Soul says as he brings you up to his grinning face. “Afterwards, we’re heading right back here to have some more fun. You better be prepared.” Soul cackles and shoves you into his shirt pocket. He grabs the book off the table and head straight out the door. As he walks out of his apartment and down the sidewalk, you’re shivering in his pocket from pure fright. Soul was clearly a sadistic and cruel teenager. You knew you weren’t going to last long at this rate. The way Soul looked at you with those hungry eyes…he really wanted to eat you, no matter how much he told himself he couldn’t. Eventually his primal need for food would overcome him and you’d be in for a one-way trip to the weapon’s gut.

“It’s a good thing I didn’t borrow this from Shibusen’s library.” the white haired male said to himself as he looked over the cover of Cooler than Cool. Shibusen has a much larger variety of books, but they also had a very strict return policy. The last time Soul had returned a book late there it had taken all of his birthday money to pay the late fee.

The Death City Library was very close to Soul’s apartment, so it only took about ten minutes to reach it on foot. The shark toothed teen walked through the buildings double doors, located the return desk, and id what he had come here to do. As he turned around to head home, he suddenly stopped and gazed into the library.

“May as well see if they have the sequel while I’m here. That WAS a pretty cool book.” With a new objective in mind, Soul heads deeper into the library to search for another book to rent. “Hehe, and while I’m reading it, you can rub my feet or something.” Soul pats you through his pocket, making you cringe at the thought of rubbing his sweaty, odorous feet.

When Soul found the section of the library that had the last book he borrowed, he immediately began searching for its sequel.

“I think it was called Cooler Than Ever Before…” Soul mumbled to himself as he looked through the book shelves. While he was searching, a certain loud and obnoxious voice grabbed his attention.

“Hey, hey, hey!! Where are you Soul!?” shouted the familiar voice of Black Star. Soul’s eyes bulged out of his head as he looked past the book shelf and saw his blue haired friend at the library’s doorway. One of the library employees approached the meister and kindly asked him to lower his voice. That was a very bad idea, as shown when Black Star grabbed the man by the collar of his shirt. “No one tells Black Star to quiet down! I can be as loud as I want!!” Black Star tossed the man aside and walked into the library. He was clearly pissed that Soul ditched him, but how had he found him?

“Ah crap.” Soul cursed as he hid behind the bookshelf. “If he finds me, it isn’t going to be cool at all. I better find a place to hide…”
132111121111211112.title: A Trip to the Library

choices: A spell to make himself grow
A spell to make others shrink
1321111211112111121.content:
As soon as you heard Black*Star's voice your spirit soared. Yes! He was nearby again! You knew that Soul had fed Black*Star some lies about you using and dumping Black*Star so there was a good chance he wasn't going to be in a very good mood when he saw you again, but you felt like you could convince him that Soul had be lying before. There was no guarantee that he wouldn't step on you the second he saw you, being not only hot headed and impulsive, but also an idiot. However, if you stayed with Soul there was more than a good chance that you were going to end up dead, probably by digestion. You were about to stick your head out and start shouting and waving when Soul's hand stuffed a small ball of tissue down over you, forcing you to the bottom of the pocket. He had crumpled it in such a way that you couldn't dislodge it, or even move it. It was incredibly frustrating! Even tissues were stronger than you now!

Soul was glad to see Black*Star dash to a different section of the library, still shouting all the while, despite the fact that librarians and other employees were all starting to follow him around, trying to get him to settle down and be quiet. This gave Soul ample opportunity to slip away, looking for a good place to hide. He passed by general stacks, children books, contemporary fiction, classical fiction, adult fiction, all the public stacks. They were all too obvious. Black*Star would eventually search all these places. He couldn't hide in the bathroom either. He'd definitely check there. Soul was about to give up finding a hiding place in the library when he passed by a door that had the words "Employees Only" stamped on it in all capitol black block letters. Soul experimentally tired the knob and was pleased to find it wasn't locked. He slipped inside this room and closed the door behind him, locking it. If nothing else it would hold off Black*Star. Soul, now afforded a few minutes of peace, looked around the room. It seemed that this room was designed a lot like the main part of the library, with two floors stuffed with books. Soul walked over to the nearest stack and started looking at the titles.

"Whoah...what is this?" He muttered to himself, looking over the leather bound book.

The title of it was written in some kind of unknown language (unknown to him anyway) and when he opened it, the book was filled with illustrations of various transformations, each apparently brought about by some kind of magic. This was a book on witchcraft! What was something like this doing in a public library? He put it back on the shelf and looked at the other others. They were all books of magic and witches, each one detailing various accounts of spells, potions, and incantations that various witches had used over the centuries, from the newest witches who first started displaying magic, all the way back to the head witch and her first spells. It was amazing, but ultimately boring since Soul couldn't read a single word in any of them. Heading up to the second floor, a glint of sunlight reflecting off of a glass case caught Soul's attention. He walked over to it and was surprised to see a book much like the others on the shelves, but in English! The cover read "Magick of Desire". Intrigued, Soul transformed his arm and slowly cut a hole in the case. He pulled out the book and opened it to the first page.

"Those who read these pages, learn the spells to make your greatest desires a reality."

Soul grinned. That sounded like fun. Too bad he wasn't a Witch. Spells could only be performed by Witches after all. He continued to read the page and his eyes widened as he happened upon a very interesting sentence.

"These spells are not restricted to those with Witches blood. Any human or weapon, with sufficient practice, can learn cast the spells within."

Soul's evil grin grew wider as he looked into the table of contents. This might be just what he was looking for...

A loud pounding suddenly echoed through the room. "Soul! Are you in there? If you are get out and face me like a man!"

Soul groaned. He didn't have time for this. He tucked the book under his shirt and quickly put a random book in the case, covering the hole back up. He looked around and saw a back exit. Nice. Now he could make a clean getaway. The door led to an alley behind the library. It only took a few minutes to reach his apartment again. Once safely inside his room, Maka still at school, he sat down at his desk and opened the book. He scanned through the contents again, looking for a spell he could use to make his dream of owning a bunch of little slaves a reality.

But what kind of spell does he find?
1321111211112111121.title: Powerful Magic

choices: The spell works and Soul starts growing.
Soul said the incantation wrong and the spell backfires.
13211112111121111211.content:
“Let’s see here…” Soul muttered as he dragged his finger down the long table of contents. “There’s a spell for turning things into gold…an eternal youth spell…a sex change spell?” Soul grimaced as he made a mental note to avoid that page. “Come on, there has to be a size change spell in here somewhere! Don’t tell me no one’s ever thought about-AHA!!” Soul grinned like an excited child as he quickly turned to the 108th page of the book. “Bingo! The Enlargement Spell.”

On the page was an illustration of two people. One was supposedly a normal person, while the other was gigantic. The normal one only reached up to the giant’s ankle. The scheming weapon eagerly started reading the spell’s description.

“This spell will turn even the smallest of people into one who towers over all. They will be granted immeasurable strength and power. Your enemies will kneel before you as you decide their fate. Take caution, however, as this spell comes with a heavy price. Once grown, the caster will have an unquenchable hunger. A hunger for destruction. A hunger for sex. A hunger for consumption.”

“Hehehe. Sounds perfect.” Soul whispered as he continued reading.

“By consuming the bodies and souls of others, the caster will continue to experience growth. The limits of this growth is unknown, as the only known user of this spell fell off a cliff shortly after consuming his entire village. The earth that his village was built on could not support his new weight and he and his home vanished into the planet.”

“Wow…what an idiot. I’m not going to make that mistake.” Soul looked further down the page and spotted a group of nonsense words. This was most likely the incantation. Underneath that were instructions on how to prepare the ritual. Soul took a few moments to mutter the incantation under his breath until he was confident he was saying each word correctly. Magic was dangerous stuff; one mispronounced word could ruin everything.

“Hey, bug, take a look at this.” Soul reaches into his pocket and takes you out. You’re tossed onto the book and ordered to read. Even though the words are huge to you, you understand the gist of what it says.

“Soul, this spell is too dangerous! You can’t use it!” you yell at him. Your words put a sour look on his face.

“Don’t tell me what I can and can’t do!” Soul angrily shouts at you before snatching you and the book up. “This spell is going to turn me into more than just a teenage weapon! I’m going to become HUGE!”

Soul cackles evilly and carelessly drops you onto the floor. You land on your butt and yelp . As you caress your behind, you watch Soul stomp over to his closet and look through it. After a few seconds, he comes out with a piece of chalk which he uses to draw a circle on the floor. In that circle he draws all kinds of symbols and markings that mean nothing to him. All he cares about is that they’re going to make him a giant. Once he’s finished, he stands in the center of the circle and looks back at the book to see what else he needs.

“I drew the circle, next is…ah crud. A blood sample.” Soul sighs heavily. “Why is there always blood involved?” Soul turns one of his fingers into a blade and carefully pricks the tip of one of his fingers. He winces as the liquid, as crimson as his eyes, leaks from his finger and drips to the floor. After three or four droplets have hit the circle, he puts the finger into his mouth and coats the cut with saliva.

“Now for the incantation…” Soul goes through the words once last time in his head. Meanwhile, you’re running over to him and waving your arms wildly.

“Soul! Please stop! You don’t have to do this! You can do anything you want with me; you don’t need to make everyone else your slave!”

Unfortunately, Soul has lost complete interest in you. You’re just one tiny human….he wants more. He wants everyone in Death City. Perhaps…everyone in the entire world!

“Vestago infinitus. Mea dir o fa. Elope…draka!!”

As soon as the words have been spoken, the circle underneath Soul starts to glow white. The light starts to move, as if it’s alive. It centers around the drops of blood before shooting up and reacting with the blood’s owner. Soul drops the book (narrowly missing you) and allows the light to surround him. This was it…the intoxicating feeling he was getting whenever he looked at you. He was about to experience it like never before.
13211112111121111211.title: Soul's Desire

choices: Follow you as you search for Black*Star
Follow Soul as he starts his rampage
132111121111211112111.content:
You watched in a mixture of horror and fascination as the white light engulfed Soul completely, hiding him from sight behind a veil of pure white light. You shielded your eyes as the light became unbearable to look at. After a few minutes of this, the light suddenly shut off, leaving only Soul standing in the circle, all the careful symbols gone from the chalk circle as though Soul's body had absorbed them all. Soul had a look of pleasure on his face as he looked over his body. No immediate changes were apparent. He seemed to be the same old frightening teen weapon as he always had.

The reason for this was simple. Soul was experiencing nothing but euphoria inside his body, the magic stretching and strengthening his muscles and bones, preparing them for the surge of growth that was fast on its way. The incantation worked in such a way that modesty would be preserved, so his clothes would grow with him. He had kicked off his shoes before he came into his room, so his bare toes were wiggling against the cold wooden floor, a grand tingling sensation starting there, flowing through his soles and up his legs, pooling in his groin, stomach, and chest, flowing down his arms and into his very fingertips, the last sensation traveling like a spike to his brain. At that spike his eyes went from being half lidded in pleasure to being shot wide with energy and power.

He clenched his fists, the power building up inside his body, slowly pushing his limbs out, stretching them longer, his height slowly increasing. He chuckled to himself, watching as his greatest desire became reality before his eyes. With a slight surge, he grew a couple more feet, his head nearly at the ceiling, his bare feet slowly advancing on your position. His chuckles grew into full fledged laughs, his voice becoming more booming as he grew more, his head slamming into the ceiling. This cut off his laughter sharply, plaster bits raining down on the ceiling, nearly squashing you several times, large cracks radiating out from where Soul's head had struck. He bent over slightly and rubbed the top of his head. "Dammit...stupid low nine foot ceilings..."

He sat down, his back against the door, his growing feet sticking out in front of him. He sighed in relief...and then surged again, his feet breaking through the opposite wall, his head slamming into the ceiling again. He couldn't help but laugh as he slowly filled the room. "That spell was pretty potent! Totally cool."

While Soul was enjoying his expanding body, you were dodging falling debris, furniture, and massive Soul body parts. You had nearly been crushed into paste by a toe that several times your body size. Luckily for you, Soul's gigantic and still growing feet had punched sizable holes in the wall. Thinking fast, you dove out through the hole, landing on top of Soul's foot. You carefully walked over to the skin between his big and second toe and looked down. The street was still very far away, and several people had noticed that a giant pair of feet and legs had suddenly appeared through the wall of an apartment building. With another surge, Soul's arms appeared on either side of the building, sounds of massive wreckage clearly heard from within. This surge allowed Soul's feet to plow into the ground, making it much easier for you to jump onto the ground. Soul's growth went through one more powerful surge, sending his entire body bursting out of the building, the remnants falling around him into rubble. Soul grinned and got to his feet, brushing the dust and debris off like nothing. He got to his feet and crossed his arms, looking around at the gathered people. He licked his lips, his stomach growling. "Guess that's the unquenchable hunger. Time to get even bigger!"

He took a single step forward and grabbed a fleeing man, lifting him up to his drooling maw. He carelessly tossed the man into his mouth, swallowing him down, his body and soul making him grow even bigger. He laughed and said, "This whole city is a buffet waiting to happen!"

To the average people of Death City, Soul was a powerful giant, their puny bodies standing no bigger than his ankles. To you, Soul was a massive got of unbelievable proportions. The only good thing about this was that he was ignoring you completely. He were less than a speck to him after all. There was nothing you could do for now except slowly watch Soul grow bigger and stronger. What else could you do? Unless...maybe Black*Star could help you! It was worth a shot! Running as fast as your little legs could carry you, you started searching for Black*Star
132111121111211112111.title: Mega Soul

choices: Soul does something else with them before eating them.
1321111211112111121112.content:
To the people of Death City, it had happened so quickly. One moment they were going about there daily lives. Heading to work, hanging out with friends, or just doing some shopping. It was a typical weekday. The next, a giant Soul (who many of them had seen around town and even knew) emerged from his apartment without a single warning. Those that lived in the same apartment had just moments before their homes were pushed aside by the growing weapon. Some were crushed under his mass, others were buried under the rubble. Few escaped in time, but they weren’t safe. They became aware of this the moment Soul picked up that defenseless man and ate him. He was just the first of many.

Without even leaving the vicinity of his ruined apartment, Soul looked around and spotted his second victim. It was another man, this one attempting to hide behind a building. What he didn’t know was that Soul was big enough to see over the building. The red-eyed pianist grinned and lifted his foot over the building. With one quick stomp he tore through the roof of the building and destroyed it from the inside. The man screamed as he dove forward; his hiding some literally exploding behind him. Still dazed, the man didn’t even have time to stand up before Soul reached down and grabbed him. He brought him up to his drooling mouth and smiled toothily.

“You can run, but you can’t hide, little man.” Soul said before he slowly opened his maw wide. The man shrieks as he sees what awaits him; a wet cavern and a slick tongue ready to welcome him. Soul tosses the man into his mouth, slams his jaws shut, and sends him to his stomach with a loud gulp. At his current size these people were still large enough to require a bit of effort to swallow whole. Thanks to his career as a weapon, however, Soul had become used to forcing large things down his throat. He enjoyed the struggling man slide down his esophagus just as much as he enjoyed a soul. When the man dropped into his stomach, Soul noticed his soul was instantly extracted form his body and fused with his own. The slight burst of power made Soul grow about an inch or two bigger. The man’s now lifeless body was left to melt down in his digestive acids.

“Mmmh…you guys taste just as good as the bug did.” the giant complimented as he scanned the ground for his next meal. At the corner of his eyes he spotted someone running into an office building. Soul put on his signature shark grin and stomped over to the building. “Stop trying to hide, bugs! You need to feed me!”

The teenage giant stood over the building and squatted down. He peered into one of the windows and smirked when he saw several frightened humans cowering before his large, red eye. Soul tauntingly opened his mouth in front of the window to show the people the inside of it. He pointed into his mouth before standing to his full height and giving the onlookers a good view of his stomach. He patted his belly a few times to complete the message; they were all going into his mouth and feeding his hungry belly.

Without anymore foreplay, Soul gripped the roof of the office building and used all his strength to pry it right off. He was amazed at how easy it was; it was like ripping cardboard! After tossing the sheet of metal and stone away (which crashed into another building) Soul looked down into the building and smirked at all his tiny snacks. There were about ten huddled together in there, all ready to be plucked and eaten.

“Thanks for gathering in one place, guys!” Soul exclaimed. “Makes it easier for me!” The giant weapon looked over the group as he tried to decide which one he would eat first. His eyes finally rested on another man, this one younger and looking like a college student. Soul licked his lips and reached for the man. He seemed to know he was first and tried to escape, but Soul easily grabbed him by the back of his shirt and raised him to his face. His red eyes studied the older male and he licked his lips again. “I can tell you’re going to be a good one. I think I’ll savor you.”

“P-Please don’t…please don’t kill me, Soul! Don’t you recognize me? I’m…”

But Soul didn’t give him the chance to finish. He didn’t care about the man’s identity or his connection with him. He was hungry and wanted to get bigger, so this man was going to help him. Soul quickly threw his third victim into his mouth and closed his jaws tight. Instead of gulping him down like the other two, he took a moment to suck on the man’s body and toss him around with his tongue. He moaned in delight and just wanted to keep the man in his mouth a little longer. However, his rumbling stomach demanded food so with a single movement Soul threw his head back and swallowed the man whole. The other members of the group watched in horror as the man became nothing but a bulge in Soul’s throat that disappeared into his shirt. Soul rubbed his stomach and burped loudly.

“Delicious.” Soul closed his eyes and relished in the feeling of his body expanding another inch. He opened them again and peered down into the building. There were still nine tasty snacks all ready for him. They may as well of been on a silver platter.
1321111211112111121112.title: The Beginning

choices: You, meanwhile, are still searching for Black*Star
13211112111121111211121.content:
Watching those nine humans scurry like caught mice, helpless before his immense power, gave Soul a heated feeling deep in the pit of his stomach. He could easily see himself having some...fun with these humans, but right now his hunger for food was greater than his hunger for sex. Plus, it wouldn't be long before Shibusen saw him or caught on to what he was doing. If he was going to deal with a group of pissed off Meisters and Weapons he at least wanted to be big enough to assure that, no matter how many of them attacked, they still wouldn't be able to hurt him. Luckily, he didn't anticipate much force. Some of them would probably still think of him as their old friend Soul, instead of the new god Soul that was being born. He grinned as he thought of that. He had never considered himself a god, or as a man who would surpass god (like certain other people did) but now that he was actually able to do it...he liked it. After all, these pitiful bugs truly were under his control. His will decided if they lived or died. He had the power to pass righteous judgment on them...or just eat them because he felt like it. It was all a very cool situation. A situation he was going to take full advantage of.

But before any of that could be done, he needed to take care of his hunger pains...and those nine little humans would be a good start.

While Soul had been doing nothing but stare at them, his thoughts elsewhere thinking of godhood, the humans in the building had been desperately trying to escape. Unfortunately, the building had begun to collapse after Soul pulled off the roof. The entrances and exits were all demolished or blocked by fallen debris. The windows were in much the same shape, with Soul standing in front of the only row. Even if they did jump out and somehow manage to land safely, they would be right at Soul's feet. Not a much better prospect than where they were now. One woman had been desperately attempting to move rubble away from the door when she suddenly felt a huge wet drop fall on her, covering her in liquid. She screamed and looked up, only to see Soul's dripping maw directly above her! Before she could so much as scream again, the jaws closed around her and Soul lifted himself out of the building, rearing his head back and swallowing the woman whole. Another lump moved slowly down his throat before disappearing in his shirt. Soul grinned and the littles panicked, scrambling over themselves, trying desperately to escape. It was amusing to Soul. He watched them for awhile before reaching back inside and randomly selecting his next meal.

A younger man was caught by Soul and lifted up his mouth. The boy had seen Soul before, awhile back. He had been hanging around with Black*Star and he had remembered thinking that Soul looked kind of goofy, with his bright white hair, yellow jacket, shark teeth, and red eyes. He had instantly dismissed him as just some kid. But now, here he was being brought slowly up to that same kid's face, those "goofy" red eyes glaring at him in amusement, his shark teeth displayed in a wide grin. Looking at those shiny, dripping white teeth, the teen could easily see his terrified reflection. Slowly, Soul's mouth opened and a gust of hot air blew the teen's hair back. He began to shake uncontrollably as he stared into the wet, dark cavern ahead of him, the uvula dangling carelessly over a deadly drop into the acidic pit that was Soul's stomach. Soul tilted his head back, dangling the boy over his mouth, his long, wide tongue rolling out like a depraved parody of a red carpet, welcoming the boy to his ultimate fate. Soul lowered the boy until he was on his tongue, then let him go, his tiny body sliding down it, past his lips, past his teeth, the tongue rolling back inside, the mouth snapping shut with a sharp *click*. Soul rolled the teen around on his tongue with a look of bliss on his face before swallowing him whole, just another snack for his belly.

For the teen, it was pure hell. He was tossed and rolled around on the weapon's tongue, bashed into his teeth and tonsils before a great sucking sensation pulled him down the throat, the muscles there squeezing and massaging his body tightly as he was moved inexorably down, down, down until the esophagus opened wide and dropped him into the stomach. The light here was dim and red, the heat unbearable. He was already starting to sweat as he stumbled around half digested food and, more disturbingly, what appeared to be human bones, the acid of Soul's stomach stripping flesh away in seconds, far faster than a human digestive system ever could. There was suddenly a dull thumping sound emanating from one wall, a dark shape suddenly appearing there. Soul was patting his stomach before going back for more. The teen seemed to have been dropped down here in a lull between digestion as no acid was stinging his skin. He wandered around, trying to think of anything he could do to free himself before death took him. As he was thinking, a loud plunking sound was heard as another human met his or her fate inside the stomach. That seemed to stimulate it, as acid and other juices suddenly started dripping and flooding the stomach. The teen barely had time to scream before the great rush covered him, pulling him under, his flesh already being burned away to power Soul's body. He quickly died from the shock, his body breaking down until only his soul remained, which instantly bonded with Soul's body, increasing his size once again.

Soul licked his fingers and dove back in, grabbing two at once this time. He smirked at them and said, "Let's see if I can swallow you both at the same time!"

Without another word he tossed the two in his mouth, swallowing them, hard. They moved slowly down his throat, and he had to swallow hard a couple more times, but they eventually went down. He sighed and wiped his drooling mouth. "Better get bigger before I try that again. I don't want to choke."

Four left. He grabbed them all in his hands and watched them huddle together, staring up at him in fear, their lives in his hands. Sticking out his tongue, he slurped them up, once by one, swallowing each one as they entered his mouth until nothing was left. Soul burped loudly, putting his hands together. "Thanks for the meal."

He grinned and started hunting again, looking for more humans to devour.
13211112111121111211121.title: Food Now, Fun Later

132111121111211112111212.content:
While Soul continued his murderous rampage, you were desperately searching for Black Star. Actually, “searching for Black Star” meant blindly wandering around the streets at the pace of a bug while constantly dodging the feet of Death City’s many inhabitants. By some miracle you managed to avoid several sneakers, a few sandals, and even a couple bare feet. You collapsed onto your back and gasped for much needed breath. As you did, you looked backwards and discovered that you had barely made any progress at all. Soul’s ruined apartment was still in sight, although the white haired demon himself seemed to have disappeared deeper into the town.

“This is hopeless!” you shout as you slam your fist against the brick road. “I don’t know where I’m going or where Black Star is! He could be anywhere! Maybe I should just lay here and wait for someone to…”

“Hey, you alright?!” came a loud voice in front of you. You instantly perked up and turned to where the voice had come from. There, standing tall and proud like always, was the blue haired meister himself. He was helping a young woman to her feet after she had fallen over.

“Y-Yes…I’m alright.” the woman replied, smiling at Black Star. “Someone just tripped me during the panic.”

“You can walk, right? You should get out of here as fast as you can. Head in the opposite direction of the destruction, okay?”

“Right! Thank you so much!” the woman exclaimed before nodding and dashing out of sight. After making sure the girl got away safely, Black Star turned his attention toward the rising smoke in the distance. The muscular teen grinned and cracked his knuckles.

“Time to find out who’s attacking and punch their faces in!” Black Star shouted before he started making his way forward.

“Wait! Black Star!!” you shout from in front of the teen. The assassin somehow hears your voice and glances down at the ground. It takes a few seconds but his eyes eventually fall upon you. You had hoped for his signature smile, but you instead got his signature angry glare…

“You!!” Black Star shouted before he stomped toward you and roughly snatched you off the ground. His gloved hand held you firmly before his eyes with an almost crushing grip. It was uncomfortable and not the gentle touch you had remembered. “I’m surprised to see you alive! Now I can teach you a lesson for calling me a weak little kid!! Get ready for pain, little bug!”

“W-Wait a minute!!” you scream before Black Star can start whatever torture he had planned. “You’re mistaken! I never said any of those things! Soul kidnapped me and lied to you!”

“Are you calling my best friend a liar?” Black Star asked, not seeming to get any less angry by your plea. “I should slug you for that, however that’ll probably flatten you!” Black Star paused for a moment before grinning toothily and clenching his free hand into a fist. “Then again, maybe that’s not so bad…”

“Listen to me, Black Star! Soul isn’t as nice as he’s lead everyone to believe! He’s cruel and sadistic and he’s currently rampaging through the city!”

“Now I know you’re lying!” Black Star replies. “Soul can barely fight by himself. He’s not capable for causing this much destruction!”

“He used some kind of spell from a book to turn himself into a giant! He’s killing people, Black Star! I saw him eat two people already, but who knows how many he’s eaten since then.”

“You honestly expect me to believe you? Soul’s evil…he used a magic book to become a giant…and now he’s eating people? You might be able to fool some people with that, but not the great Black Star!”

“If you don’t believe me…then look for yourself! You won’t be able to deny the truth when you’re staring right up at it!” you tell him, getting slightly angry at Black Star’s ignorance.

“Fine, I will!” Black Star replied before he roughly stuffed you into his shirt pocket and ran toward the destruction at max speed. “Once I see you’re lying, you’re going to get it! BIG time!”

Black Star truly thought his friend was a good soul. He never thought anything strange about his shark-like grin or his blood-red eyes. He was about to get a nasty surprise…

***

Meanwhile, a bit deeper into the city, Soul was just swallowing his twentieth human snack. He felt the man glide smoothly down his throat before dropping to his stomach. The giant pianist rubbed his belly and burped long and proud.

“Man, they just keep getting better and better.” Soul commented as he scanned the ground for his twenty-first victim. As he was doing this, something interesting caught his eye. A human was running on the ground, but he wasn’t running FROM him. The human was running toward him for some reason. When the boy, who appeared to be a few years younger than himself, reached his feet he started banging on his big toe.

“You giant bully!!” screamed the boy as he banged his fists against Soul’s toe. “You ate my dad! Give him back!”

Soul blinked and stared at the frantic kid for a few seconds before he broke out into a sinister smile.

“Oops, was that guy your dad?” Soul asked before he reached down and grabbed the boy. He was wearing a hoodie, so Soul’s fingers grabbed the hood and lifted him up by that. The boy watched as he was lifted off the ground and raised past the giant’s huge body until he reached his face. As he dangled there, helpless, he started kicking and punching at Soul’s face, but his strikes just couldn’t reach. “Don’t worry, kid, you can join him…as a part of me.”

Soul slowly dragged his tongue over his lips before giving the boy a big grin. The boy looked at his terrified reflection and started to tear up. The last thing his father had told him was to run…and he hadn’t obeyed. Because of that he had watched his own father get eaten and now it looked like he was to follow.
132111121111211112111212.title: Finding Black Star

choices: Soul head downtown to get a big meal
1321111211112111121112122.content:
"Mmm...you're going to taste amazing little snack!" Soul said with an evil grin, slowly lowering the boy towards his open mouth. His tongue slapped out like the welcome mat to Hell, the cavernous mouth surrounded by razor sharp teeth. The boy began to sob, rubbing his hands against his eyes as he saw his own demise swiftly approaching. Just as his tiny feet touched Soul's tongue, Black*Star arrived on the scene.

"Soul! Wh--what's going on? What happened to you? What are you DOING?" Black*Star shouted in disbelief.

Soul growled and clenched the boy in his fist, glaring down at Black*Star. "You completely ruined the moment you idiot! Not cool!"

"The moment? You were going to EAT that kid!" Black*Star accused, pointing dramatically at Soul.

"See? Told you!" You whispered angrily into his ear.

Black*Star ignored you as Soul rolled his crimson eyes and said, "So what if I was? Look at me! I'm huge now! The people of this city are nothing more than snacks to me! So unless you want to join him in here..." He pointed at his growling belly. "...you'd better shut up and stay out of my way!"

Black*Star couldn't believe his ears! His friend, the one guy he had always hung out with, skipped school with, ate with, and fought alongside was a murderous monster all along! All it took was a little size before he showed his true colors. Black*Star clenched his fist and said, "Okay...I get it!"

Soul laughed and said, "Woah, really? I thought for sure you'd put up more of a fuss than that. Maybe you're not so dumb after all!"

The white haired giant lifted the still sobbing boy to his mouth again and tossed him in the air. Opening wide he positioned himself under the boy.
