A blue streak darted over the open maw and caught the kid, safely depositing him on a nearby roof. Soul growled angrily again and said, "You dumbass! Now you've made me angry!"

Black*Star smirked and said, "Good! Now I'm going to kick your ass and make sure you never harm anyone again!"

Soul slammed his fist down on top of Black*Star as he boasted, smashing him through all five floors easily. With another swing of his arms he collapsed the building on top of the energetic meister. Soul then snatched up the boy and tossed him into his mouth, swallowing him whole. He sighed and said, "Tastes even better after a struggle!"

He put his hands into his pocket and started walking away in search of more food. He hadn't taken any more than five steps before the rubble of the building began to shift and move. Soul glanced back and smiled. "Looks like you're still alive! Good, I was worried you'd go down too easily."

He turned around as Black*Star jumped out of the rubble, laughing wildly."Like a collapsing building could stop the mighty Black*Star! Now I'm really going to cut loose!"

Soul dug his finger into his ear and said, "You know you don't have Tsubaki right?"

Black*Star blinked a few times before he said, "Ah...HAHAHAHA! I don't need Tsubaki to beat you down!"

He charged forward and pulled back, punching Soul as hard as he could. His fist landed on Soul's big toe, the skin rippling a little at the punch. Soul sighed and pulled back his toe, flicking Black*Star backwards several feet from the simple movement. "Man...this is getting boring..."

Soul's stomach growled fiercely. "I'm done playing with you Black*Star. If you find Tsubaki come back and give me a better fight. I need to get some lunch."

He started walking away again, smelling the scent of frightened humans scampering away into hiding. He grinned and licked his lips. The hunt was on!

Black*Star, however, was way too tenacious to just give up after that! He ran forward again and jumped up, pummeling any part of Soul that he could. Soul sighed, more exasperated this time, and snatched Black*Star up in his hand. "You're really starting to piss me off!"

He squeezed Black*Star, hard, and suddenly smirked at him evilly. "You know...you'll make a good toy for me. I'm going to keep you as I grow bigger and bigger. It'll be fun to see you shrink right in front of me Mr. Big Man."

Black*Star gritted his teeth and shouted, "No way! I'm no toy! The great and powerful Black*Star won't be subdued so easily!"

Soul stuffed Black*Star into his pocket, shoving him deep into it, sticking him against some old chewing gum. "Yeah, yeah, just stay quiet until I'm ready for you."

Soul cracked his knuckles and looked around. This low traffic area was getting dull. He needed a much bigger snack to whet his appetite.
1321111211112111121112122.title: Unfair Fight with Expected Results

choices: Soul wants to satisfy his hunger for destruction!
Soul wants to satisfy his hunger for pleasure!
13211112111121111211121221.content:
With Black Star safely secured in his pocket, Soul was all set to continue his feast…courtesy of Death City. He glanced around a bit to make sure there weren’t any tasty snacks left in the general area before he moved on, blowing right through the buildings in his way. As the giant walked, his hand came up to his stomach and rubbed hit soothingly. He could feel it rumble and churn as it worked on the poor boy Black Star had failed to save and apparently demand more food.

“Easy there; more food’s on the way…” Soul told his noisy stomach as he caressed it and stomped toward the downtown area. Along the way he kept his eyes peeled for any stragglers he could snack on as he walked. As luck would have it he found several on the way; they tried hiding or running from him, but Soul didn’t even have to chance his course to snatch them up. Most of them were picked up, tossed into his mouth, and swallowed before they even knew what hit them. By the time the giant weapon arrived at his destination, he had grown another few feet.

Soul was in the more densely populated area of Death City now. Hundreds of people crowded the streets as they tried pushing through each other on their way to freedom. They all heard Soul coming and turned their heads to see the giant teenager coming their way; crimson eyes fixated upon them. Soul licked his lips hungrily as he eyed them all. The population increased their struggles to escape, but were making pour progress. In a matter of seconds Soul was upon them, the giant stomping two giant feet in the middle of the ground. Over a dozen potential snacks were flattened, but Soul didn’t care. There were plenty more where they came from…

“Mmmmm…time to pig out!” Soul announced as he squatted down and reached a large hand toward the ground. Soul scooped up a handful of people and, without bothering to stand up straight, started plucking one snack out of his palm at a time. He flicked them into his mouth and tossed them around for a bit before tilting his head back and swallowing. With the first one traveling down his esophagus, Soul didn’t waste any time in snatching up the second victim and introducing her to his mouth. He pushed the woman between his lip and sucks her into his mouth, tasting her for a bit before gulping her down. “Ahhh…you all go down so smooth.” Soul commented as he smirked down into his palm. The victims he held screamed and pleaded with him, but that’s all they could do. They watched, terrified, as Soul picked them off one at a time. They prayed not to be chosen next, but in the end they were all consumed eventually. When the last person he had grabbed, an unlucky teenager, was in his stomach Soul turned his attention back to the crowds of people below. His snacking had earned him several more feet in height; the hundreds of people watching helplessly as the giant male became even larger.

“So…who’s next on the menu?” Soul asked, licking over his pearly white teeth. He gazed into the crowd to see if he could spot anyone especially delicious. They all seemed irresistible, however. Boys and girls of all ages; they were all succulent humans with healthy souls that would make him bigger. Soul decided to screw choosing and took a different approach. He opened his carnivorous mouth wide and starting inhaling. The people were shocked when they found themselves being lifted off their feet and sent hurtling toward Soul’s mouth by the sheer force of the suction. The giant suppressed his laughter as he watched a dozen or so snacks fly into his mouth helpless. Eventually Soul snapped his jaws shut, stopping the suction and causing several people still in midair to fall to the ground below. Soul moved his slimy tongue around, rolling his mouthful of snacks around and getting all their tastes on his tongue. The innocent victims shrieked as they were drenched with salvia and slammed into Soul’s teeth, his cheeks, and each other. Soul knew he’s choke if he tried swallowing them all at once, so he used his skillful tongue to slip one person at a time to the back of his throat to be swallowed. They all watched as one by one they were sent to their door; their screams being the last thing anyone heard. Among the people in the mouth was a lone child; screaming for his parents who were no where to be found. He too was eventually swallowed down like all the rest.

When Soul had swallowed the last one on his tongue, he grabbed his stomach and burped loudly. His stomach worked on overdrive to digest all the people and Soul watched himself get bigger and broader thanks to all the souls. While he was still growing, Soul grabbed another handful of people; but only a few this time. The giant stood to his full height and brought the handful of three or four people to his eyes. One of the captured ants, a young man, tried pleading with Soul…

“P-Please don’t eat us! We’ll do anything!” begged the man as he squirmed between Soul’s tree-like fingers.

“Hehe, don’t worry, I’m not going to eat you. I think I’ll give my stomach some time to digest before I snack on anymore of you people; but you bugs can help me satisfy another hunger of mine…” Soul replied before he smiled toothily and chuckled darkly. Perhaps the man and the others in his hand were in for a fate worse than being eaten alive…
13211112111121111211121221.title: A Big Meal For a Big Eater

choices: Suddenly, a meister and their weapon partner attacks Soul.
Black Star makes his way out of Soul's pocket.
13211112111121111211121222.content:
Soul marched deeper into the city, his gut rumbling for more food as he walked. Due to the way Death City was built, Soul found himself walking downhill as he made his way to the busier sections of the city. Looking into the distance, Soul saw the wide desert that surrounded the city. He chuckled when he thought about all the people trying to evacuate. There was only one bridge connecting Death City to the rest of Nevada, and everyone would be trying to cross that bridge at the same time. They’d all be crowding the streets looking for a way to escape…easy picking for Soul. In fact, the giant weapon only had to walk for a minute before he spotted a street packed with panicking civilians. Soul grinned and stomped over to them. It was snack time again…

Meanwhile, inside Soul’s pocket…

“Grrrr, this is ridicules!” shouted Black Star. “I’m the great and mighty Black Star! I won’t be done in by some chewing gum!” Black Star thrashed and struggled, but the sticky pink gum would not release him. The meister grunted and used all his strength, puffing up his muscles and bringing them to the point where his veins started to show through his skin. Even though he was putting in enough effort to lift a boulder three times his size, he still couldn’t seem to free himself from some giant gum. Every time he pulled an arm back, it would snap back into place.

“Son of a-!” Black Star muttered at the seventh failed attempt. Soon the sound of screaming came from outside, followed by Soul nosily feasting. The giant albino stuffed his face with one tasty morsel at a time, swallowing each one whole by the sound of it. Black Star’s face twisted into something that combined the emotions of despair and anger. His best friend was killing innocent people and there wasn’t a damn thing he could do about it! All the blue-haired ninja could do was watch as his pocket prison slowly became bigger. The gum he was stuck to also enlarged, slowly enveloping his body. “What the…why is the gum growing too?!”

“I think I know why.” came your squeaky voice as you popped your head out of Black Star’s shirt pocket.

“Well spill it out…” Black Star tilted his head and looked down at you.

“Well…Soul’s clothes also seem to be growing, so I think everything that was caught in the growth spell grows along with him.”

“I see…” muttered Black Star as his limbs slowly sunk into the growing chewing gum. “Too bad that doesn’t help me escape! It’s just making it harder!”

You thought for a minute, studying the large meister’s situation, before replying, “Why don’t you use Soul Menace?”

“Soul Menace?”

“Yeah! You have a massive soul wavelength, right? So you can use Soul Menace to drive your soul wavelength right out of your body and into the gum.”

“Hmm…that’s not a bad idea, little guy! You’re pretty smart. Alright, sit back and watch this!” Black Star closed his eyes and focused his soul wavelength into his arms. He then forced it out of his body in a single pulse, disintegrating the gum around his arms. He did the same with his legs and torso, freeing himself completely and allowing him to roll to the bottom of the pocket. “Yahoo! Take that, chewing gum!”

“Nice job, Black Star!” you praised as the assassin placed his hands on his hips and laughed. “Now we just have to get out of here and find Tsubaki!”

Black Star looked up at the opening high above and smiled. “No problem!” The energetic teen grabbed onto the wall of the pocket and began scaling up it. That beating Soul had given him didn’t seem to have much of a lasting effect, since Black Star was climbing out of here at top speed!
Outside, Soul was toying around with a young couple in his palm. He poked and prodded them with his finger, showing them how bigger his finger was compared to them.

“Haha, look how big I’ve gotten! Before I could barely swallow two of you. Now…” Soul tossed the couple into his mouth and swallowed them whole. “…you go down smooooth.” Soul burped mightily and waited for the couple’s souls to bond with him. When they eventually did, Soul felt himself get a tad bit bigger…but not by very much. “Heh, it take a lot of you pathetic bugs to make me bigger. I wonder what would happen if I consumed a more powerful soul…”
13211112111121111211121222.title: Meister Vs. Gum

choices: Soul continues his rampage while Shibusen forms a plan
132111121111211112111212221.content:
Soul looked around, surveying the area, taking in all the little bugs that were still attempting to escape. It was really quite amusing. Soul was getting tired of just eating these appetizers though. He wanted to eat something REALLY tasty. He drooled slightly as he thought of eating a soul that was rich in spiritual power, something that he could really enjoy. Souls like that were stockpiled in the dozens at the Academy, but he wasn't quite confident enough to try to take that on just yet. Especially since Lord Death was there himself. Soul knew he was capable of taking on the students, but Death was a whole other game. He wasn't going to go after him until he was good and ready, namely, with all of the citizens, Meisters, and Weapons of Death City in his gurgling belly. First things first...he needed to find an isolated Meister and their weapon. He patted his pocket, unknowingly knocking Black*Star back down to the bottom of the pocket, much to the blue haired assassin's frustration. Soul knew he could easily swallow Black*Star but he wanted his friend turned bug to see the outcome of all this. He needed someone else...

Almost as though on cue, a bolt of lightning crashed down on Soul's head, singing his hat, but otherwise causing no visible damage to his giant body. Soul looked up in annoyance and grinned when he saw Ox dropping down on him from above, wielding Harvar in Lance form. "Perfect! You'll both do nicely."

Soul stepped aside, shoving his hands coolly in his pockets as Ox crashed into the ground, lightning radiating around from where Harvar was slammed into the ground. The bolts raced over and under Souls' bare feet but only managed to cause a slight shock, like touching metal after building up static. It was barely annoying. Soul laughed and said, "Wow, not even Meisters with weapons stand a chance against me!"

Ox, a determined look on his face, charged forward and buried the lance into Soul's soft foot, causing him to wince at the pin prick. Blood trickled out of the wound and Soul got a pissed off expression on his face. "Alright...that was just uncool."

As Soul and Ox fought, Soul never taking his hands out of his pockets, Black*Star found himself trapped under Soul's enormous fingers, pinned down at the bottom of the pocket. "Oh dammit! This sucks!" He leaned forward and bit the finger as hard as he could, hoping that Soul would shift his fingers, even a little bit. He was out of luck. The constant lightning assaults from Harvar kept Soul from feeling the incredibly minor nipping at his finger. You crawled out of Black*Star's pocket and assessed the situation. Things weren't looking good...and if even Black*Star couldn't move Soul's fingers, what chance did you have?

Back outside, Soul was grinning as he batted aside Ox's attacks. It was too easy! It was like he was playing with a bee. Sure he was fast, and sure his attacks stung a little, but it was ultimately just a game to the giant weapon. Every attack, every variation on his regular attacks, everything he threw at Soul, Ox watched fail. This wasn't good. He had come here outside of all orders after Kim had broken down. Apparently one of the people Soul had eaten had been a close friend of hers. Seeing his love in tears he disobeyed Stein, Sid, and every other authority figure in the school and rushed out to bring the monster to justice. He was starting to sweat now as he realized that every single one of his attacks, no matter how devastating they were to the human body, were nothing compared to Soul. He was now above the average human. He had one last trick up his sleeve. An attack he had been working on in secret with Harvar. It combined offense and defense into a single powerful attack! He held Harvar out in front of him and lightning instantly began to dart out of the lance, surrounding him.

Soul stopped moving around and watched, wondering what the strange boy was planning on doing now. He smirked as he saw the lightning form into a tight ball around Ox, looking solid and impenetrable. He took a step forward and leaned down. It turned out that the ball was surging and crackling with lightning. Suddenly, the ball rose up and smacked Soul in the face, shocking him and, at the same time, piercing his skin. He took a step back, shocked at the sudden ferocity he felt in the attack force. He touched a hand to his face and pulled it away. Blood. He glared at the ball that was dancing around in front of him. Before he could make a move, it attacked again, slamming into his body from all directions, moving faster than he could follow with his eyes. Soul pulled his hands out of his pocket and really concentrated, waiting....waiting....

When the ball slammed into his chest, his hands darted up, grabbing the ball and holding it still. He could feel the lance stabbing hundreds of times into each hand, drawing blood and shocking his system all the while. Still, Soul held on, slowly bringing his hands closer together. The ball began to warp and distort, unable to stand up to the power of Soul's mighty hands. Ox and Harvar put up a valiant effort, but, soon enough, the ball shattered around them, leaving both boys a drained mess in Soul's palm.

"Man...you guys put up a good fight." Soul said with an evil grin. "But not good enough!"

Without a second though Soul popped the teens into his mouth and swallowed them easily. Soul patted his stomach and started whistling, moving on his merry way to look for more snacks. He had only taken a few steps, however, when a surge of energy shot through his body. He stopped dead, his eyes widening as he felt like power, raw, unchecked power, was overflowing his body. Both Ox and Harvar's souls were big enough that, when materialized, could cover their whole bodies easily. They were enormous compared to the average, hand held souls that Soul had been eating before. The difference was staggering! Within seconds his body had blown up larger, his bare feet tearing through the streets and slamming into buildings as Soul began to tower over the city. His arms smashed through the tops of the buildings, the sleeves of his jacket growing just a bit tighter, his whole body thickening as well as growing taller, his already slightly defined muscles growing more defined. His clothes were slightly tight on him as his growth stopped, with the bugs now standing easily half as tall as his toes.

"Heh...and that was just from TWO souls!" Soul said, looking around at the much smaller city, the buildings standing no larger than his knees at the highest point...at this part of town anyway. "Once all of Shibusen is in my belly Death won't stand a chance! Looks like I'll be dining on god tonight!"

Soul laughed and continued on his way, feeling much more energized after his meal. So many souls, so little time.
132111121111211112111212221.title: Fuel to the Fire

choices: Soul decides to toy with Black Star.
Maka and Tsubaki try to sneak out of Shibusen.
1321111211112111121112122211.content:
Each catastrophic step Soul took brought untold destruction to the city. The red eyed giant laughed at the chaos he was making just by walking. He was bigger than everything in the city now; save for Shibusen itself. The school was still a ways away, but Soul would get there eventually. The god-like teenager decided he was just going to take his time and enjoy the ruin he was bringing his former home.

As Soul trekked he took notice of a street in front of him that was full of people trying to get away. Once the city folk noticed Soul’s deafening footsteps and looked up at him, they stopped their fruitless escape attempt. Many of the humans had seen the colossal Soul only minutes before, but now he was even bigger! They also noticed the teen looked more broad than when they last set eyes on him, making him even more of an intimidating sight. Soul smirked amusingly as he gave the city below one last footfall before coming to a stop. The albino giant gazed down at the littles below with a look one would give a bunch of ants.

“You all stopped running…” Soul observed as he looked over each terrified face, somehow capable of spotting ever detail on them as if he was inches from them. “Did you finally realize there’s no running from THIS anymore?” Soul grinned toothily as he flexed his arms. The sound of tearing could be heard inside his jacket, but not visible rips could be seen yet. If those muscles got any bigger, though…

“H-he’s going to eat us…” a woman stated as she started backing away from the towering god. Despite her voice being a whisper and that few people in the crowd had heard her, Soul himself had heard her worry loud and clear. It would appear that not only was his size and muscle mass increasing, but also his senses!

“Don’t fret, little gal,” Soul said as he put his arms down. The scythe weapon slowly picked his right foot up and brought it over to the crowd. All the people watched in horror as the impossibly huge foot raised down chunks of debris as it positioned itself above them. It blocked out the sun as it hanged above them; chunks of smashed building and concrete still visible between the folds of the boy’s sole. “You little humans no longer do anything for me. I need more powerful souls now; you specks are just in the way.”

With that Soul stomped his foot down as hard as he could. Needless to say, all the people caught under the sole died instantly. Those that had been outside of the foot’s shadow weren’t saved either, however. The people nearby were picked up my the impact shockwave and hurled into buildings at high speed. Others further away found the ground beneath them opening up and they fell screaming into darkness. Soul cackled like a maniac as he watched buildings around him collapse just because of one stomp.

“This power is too cool.” Soul said to himself as he walked over the crater he had made. “I should of done this a long time ago! Who needs to be a weapon when you can be a god?!” Soul licked his lips as he thought about eating more meisters and weapons and becoming even bigger. There was no rush, however, Shibusen wasn’t going anywhere and Soul felt like satisfying some other “hungers”.

*Meanwhile, in Shibusen…*

“This is horrible…” Marie uttered as she watched the events unfold on the large screen before her. The Death room was currently occupied by five figures. There figures were Professor Stein, the two female death scythes, Spirit, and Death himself. They were watching Soul’s endless rampage on a large television screen summoned up by Death. The masked god of death was currently sitting in an eerie-looking chair while sipping from a glass of tea. Due to his mask, no one could read his expression or how he was drinking that tea…

“Lord Death, we can’t let this continue!” Yumi spoke up as she tipped her glasses and faced her superior.

“hat would you have me do, Yumi-chan?” Death replied as he took another sip from his glass.

“Well…Lord Death, I’m confident YOU could teach that brat a lesson! So…”

“I will not be doing combat with Soul just yet. It’s not the right time….”

“B-but Lord Death! Innocent people are being killed by-”

The Japanese death scythe was silenced by a motion of Death’s hand. “This city has become rather dull lately. Plus, it was the citizens of Death City that chose to live here. They believed they’d be safe in the same city Shibusen was located in; I bet they never expected it would lead to this kind of disaster.

“But..” Yumi muttered, but stopped when Spirit put a hand on her shoulder.

“Lord Death has made up his mind, it’d be pointless to speak further.” red haired weapon stated. Yumi bit her lip and nodded.

“There must be something we can do…” Yumi stroked her chin as she tried to come up with a plan. “The students are getting uneasy. We know Soul must be heading this way, but we can’t risk evacuating everyone. They might try to break off from the group and challenge Soul…we can’t have another Ox and Harvar.”

Stein, who had remained silent through the whole ordeal, was flipping through a small notepad when he spoke up. “According to the information we’ve gathered, Soul was seen sneaking out of the Death City Library with a book in hand. Shortly afterwards he grew and started causing havoc.”

“Do you think that book has something to do with this?” Death Scythe asked.

“I do. If we can recover that book from the remains of Soul’s apartment we may be able to find a way to counter this new power of his.”

“But it could take hours to search through all that rubble!” Marie replied, imaging all the death and destruction Soul was causing with each second that ticked by.

“Do you have a better plan?” Stein asked as he took a puff of his cigarette. “Would you like to throw all of Shibusen at him and hope for the best?”

“N-no…I…” Marie bowed her head and said nothing more. Stein pocketed the notepad and made his way toward the door.

“I’ll start forming a search team. We’ll head out as soon as we‘re ready.”

“Very well. I’ll remain here with Lord Death.” Maka’s father replied as he looked back at the screen. If Soul did make it here and tried to attack Death, he would be here to fight along side him. That wasn’t the only reason he wanted to remain in Shibusen, however. “Maka…I can’t even begin to image what you’re feeling right now.”
1321111211112111121112122211.title: Shibusen Starts to Move

choices: Soul fights Black*Star before Maka's soul adds to his power
Soul fights Black*Star after Maka's soul adds to his power
13211112111121111211121222112.content:
"Maka...are you sure this is a good idea?" The dark haired weapon was following close behind a short girl with pigtails, looking incredibly nervous as the pair sneaked around a hallway in Shibusen. Lord Death had ordered all students to remain in the auditorium, the biggest room in the building, and not leave for any reason without an escort.

"Of course this is! I'm not going to let Soul keep doing...what he's doing!" Maka was unbelievably angry. She refused, point blank, to accept that her friend and partner Soul would do something like this. It HAD to be Kishin or Witches magic controlling him, making him do things he would never do! She fought back tears at the believed torture her friend was enduring and said, "We have to save Soul! You know Black*Star is out there somewhere too!"

Tsubaki nodded and said, "Yes of course. You're right! We can't just sit back and let this continue!"

The two quickly made their way through the halls, Maka using her soul sensing abilities to avoid any teacher or adult that was patrolling the halls. It took a long time, but they eventually made it to the outside of the building. However, the gates surrounding the school were now closed tight. "Okay...we're going to have to go over the gates!"

"But they'll see us!" Tsubaki argue, looking nervously at all the big empty space in the school's courtyard.

"They wont' see us! Use your Smoke Bomb Mode!" Maka explained.

"Okay....here I go!"

Tsubaki transformed into a smoke bomb and Maka grabbed her and threw her against the ground. Since their souls were not aligned properly Tsubaki was only able to let out a single column of smoke, stretching from the door of the school, to the gate. It was enough to keep the two students hidden, however, as they leaped over the gate and into the city proper.

Meanwhile, in the wreckage of Soul's house, Stein and a small force were currently searching through the remains of Soul's house. Not only did they have to contend with the rubble from Soul's own apartment building, but he also had to deal with the surrounding buildings, which had collapsed and added their rubble to the mess. Not to mention it was perfectly possible that the book would be damaged beyond repair if they even managed to find it. It felt like a wild goose chase to almost everyone involved, but in the backs of their minds they knew they had no other choice. A rumble suddenly was felt through the area as, far away, Soul stomped out some more buildings and probably people, his bone chilling laugh echoing across the city. Time was most certainly of the essence!

As all of this was going on, Maka and Tsubaki were quickly making their way to Soul's location. It wasn't exactly hard to find him, since he stretched up higher than every building except Shibusen. Tsubaki was starting to get even more nervous, seeing how enormous Soul looked. They had been told he was a huge giant but actually SEEING it was a completely different experience!

"M-Maka...are you sure we can do this?" Tsubaki asked, voice quivering slightly.

"Yes! We have to!" Maka replied, looking around for a good, tall building around Soul to climb. If she could get close enough she could begin to start talking some sense into him! "There!'

She pointed to a rather large office building that managed to stretch up to just above Soul's knees. It was the best they could hope for. The two female students rushed over to the building and ran inside. It was one of the few not totally decimated by Soul. He was making his way over to it though, so it wouldn't be standing for long. The elevator was in working condition so they took it all the way up to the roof. Once there, Maka ran to the edge of the building, cupped her hands around her mouth and shouted, "SOOOOOOUL!"

Soul, his hearing sensitive to every whisper, turned his head and saw Maka waving her arms at him. He grinned and walked over to the building, crouching down so he was face height to the two girls.

"Hey you two. Pretty impressive huh? And I'm only going to get bigger!" Soul grinned and Tsubaki nearly fainted.

Maka stayed strong and shouted, "Soul! You idiot! What do you think you're doing? This isn't like you at all!"

Soul waved a finger and said, "Guess you didn't know me as well as you thought you did Maka! I've always been like this. There's just never been an opportunity to show it!"

"You're eating HUMAN SOULS! You're going to turn into a Kishin!" Maka insisted.

"No, I won't!" Soul argued back, his smile disappearing. "My soul is staying just the way it is! This whole thing was brought on by a Witch spell so it's totally different than an average human just eating souls."

Maka turned to Tsubaki and whispered, "Hear that? Go back to Shibusen and let them know about the spell!"

Soul laughed and said, "I can still hear you just fine Maka. And no one is going anywhere except in my stomach!"

He reached out and grabbed Maka in his fist, the girl caught totally off guard by Soul's speed and dexterity. She struggled to free herself as Soul Slowly brought her up to his drooling mouth. "Mmm...you're going to be a great snack Maka!"

Maka screamed and struggled, desperate not to get eaten by her once caring partner.

"Not so fast Soul!"

Soul stopped the movement, just as his hand was about to toss Maka into his gaping mouth and frowned at the building top. Black*Star was grinning up at him, holding Tsubaki in weapon form out in front of him.

"Oh jeez...not this again. Why can't you just give up and watch like a good slave?" Soul asked, shaking his head.

"The mighty Black*Star is no man's slave! I'm going to beat you into submission and make sure you never hurt another person again!" The energetic assassin shouted, getting ready to attack Soul.

The shark toothed weapon grinned and lifted Maka up to his mouth. "Hope you don't mind if I have a pre fight snack!"

Before Black*Star could react, Soul dropped Maka into his mouth. He swished her around inside and grinned as he tilted his head back...and swallowed! Black*Star and Tsubaki could only watch in horror as Soul so easily dispatched what they thought was his closest friend.

"That's IT!" Black*Star shouted, his temper rising through the roof. "You will PAY for this!"

Soul licked his lips and put his hands in his pockets, waiting for Black*Star's best.
13211112111121111211121222112.title: So Much For Diplomacy...

choices: Black Star swallows his pride and makes a tactical retreat.
132111121111211112111212221122.content:
“Alright, Tsubaki, Soul Resonance!” Black Star shouted as his weapon morphed into her Uncanny Sword form. He held the black blade up to his face as the two’s souls started to synchronize. Black lines appears over Black Star’s body as it started radiating a powerful soul wavelength. A pillar of visible energy emerged from Black Star and shot into the sky. The power he was emitting was impressive; it might even be enough to rival Soul’s…for right now. “I was going to just put you out of commission, Soul, but now I’m really going to kill you!!” the blue haired ninja yelled a she fought back the tears that were forming in his eyes. He couldn’t believe things had gotten this far. If he did survive this battle; things were never going to be the same again.

Black Star leaped off the building and flung himself at Soul. Tsubaki crackled with black energy as he got ready to swing at the giant’s midsection. Before he could even touch him Soul gave off a powerful pulse of energy. His soul wavelength was enough to reverse his attacker’s direction and send him flying backwards. Black Star did a flip in midair and landed on the same building he started on. He watched as Soul looked down at himself and grinned. The giant pulsed with power a few more times before he started growing again.

“Oh yeeeaaah! I can feel it!” Soul exclaimed as he clenched his fists and watched the city get further away. His expanding bare feet tore through any remaining buildings like they were made of Styrofoam. Black Star had to hop to another rooftop before the one he was standing on collapsed. Soul’s toes, formerly twice as big as a person, were growing to become the size of small homes. Soul’s maroon pants started to rip and tear at the thighs as his leg muscles grew bigger, harder, and stronger. Black Star (who was now staring Soul’s crotch instead of his stomach) could see that every part of Soul was growing; even the monster tucked away in those pants of his. The albino god felt his arms muscles thicken and become more detailed. A quick flex tore his sleeves at his biceps, revealing those two hills of perfect, round dominance. His pecs grew behind his jacket, making themselves known by pressed against the yellow and black fabric. The top button on the jacket popped off and Soul’s top opened a bit, revealing just a tease of that sculpted chest. The bottom of the jacket rode up a bit, allowing a bit of the weapon’s eight-pack to be shown to the world.

“Looks like my clothes are having trouble keeping up with the growth!” Soul said as he flexed his arms behind his head, tearing the jacket some more at the shoulders. “Oh Maka…I feel closer to you than EVER!”

“N-no…” Tsubaki whispered in a choked up voice. “Maka…she’s already been…”

“Hold it together, Tsubaki.” Black Star said as he clenched the blade’s hilt tighter. “Maka…she was doomed the moment Soul got his grimy hands on her!”

Soul looked down at Black Star and smirked devilishly. The smug look on his face was enough to make Black Star charge forth with his neck attack.

“Shadow*Star!” Black Star commanded as he took up a fighting stance. His shadow was then possessed by Tsubaki and sprang to life. Large tendrils of darkness wiped out at the giant, smacking into his body with crushing force. The blows were enough to split buildings, but Soul just kept his muscled arms relaxed behind his head and took them all. Black Star kept up the assault for an entire minute, but the toll the Uncanny Sword was having on him forced him to stop. He observed Soul and grinded his teeth when he realized he hadn’t even make a cut in Soul’s clothes.

“Was that it? I barely f-”

“Shadow*Star: Gathering Cutter!!” Black Star shouted, not giving the cocky giant a chance to finish. The tendrils once again formed out of Black Star’s shadow, but this time they wrapped around Soul’s legs, waits, and arms. They were meant for restraining the target, but the giant Soul could easily move his arms despite the restraints. What’s more; Tsubaki was trying to pull Soul closer to them so her partner could deliver a fatal blow, but Soul didn’t even notice the effort.

“You really are weak.” Soul said as he grabbed one of the shadow tendrils. The titan pulled on the rope, easily dragging Black Star off the roof and toward him. Without giving the assassin a chance to counter, Soul punched him in mid air. Black Star was hit square in the chest with one of Soul’s knuckles. The blow was so unbelievable that the teen blacked out the moment he was hit. He was in an unconscious state as his body spiraled through several buildings before hitting the ground hard, forming a crater. Soul stomped over to the place he had landed and waved away the smoke. To his surprise, the meister was standing on one knee, Tsubaki implanted in the ground for support. A trickle of blood dripped from his lip and his body was bruised all over. The black lines that had formed on his skin were also gone. “Hmmm…well I guess you aren’t that week. Your soul would probably make me shoot right up, too bad I’ve already decided to keep you around. Your little toothpick on the other hand…”

Black Star grunted and pulled Tsubaki out of the ground. He got back into a fighting stance and glared up at Soul hatefully. He thought about giving the toe in front of him a deep cut, but feared Tsubaki might just break in half from the attempt…

“Black Star…we should retreat! He’s too strong for us…we need help!” Tsubaki pleaded, her strained voice showing that she had also taken some damage from the blow.

“I can take him! I haven’t even started to use my most powerful techniques!” Black Star said as he held Tsubaki up to his face again.

“Black Star! You can’t! If you use the Uncanny Blade again in this state, your body won’t be able to take it!”

So much was going on that one thing remained forgotten: you. Your tiny form was tucked away in Black Star’s pocket. You had heard everything that had happened and was scared out of your wits. You held onto the inside of the pocket and hoped Black Star would be smart for a change and run for it. He couldn’t win this battle…Soul was HUGE. You had been too afraid to look at the behemoth due to your own diminished size, but you could tell by his thunderous footsteps and his booming voice that you were less than a grain of sand to him! Oh man…if he ever found out you were still alive…
132111121111211112111212221122.title: A Whole Different League

1321111211112111121112122211221.content:
"Y-You're right...Tsubaki. We need...to run for now!" It was obviously causing Black*Star no end of distress to have to admit this. Soul heard the assassin's defeated voice, tinged with shame at what he was forced to do. "Ha!" Soul said, grinning down at the blue speck and his sword. "What makes you think I'm going to let you get away?"

"Smoke bomb mode Tsubaki!" Black*Star shouted, Tsubaki forming into a ball in his hand which was quickly tossed to the ground. Soul blinked and sighed. "Really? That the best you can do? How uncool."

The billowing smoke filled a large part of the area, shrouding the buildings and street in darkness....unfortunately it was all pretty much useless since Soul's senses had been sharpened to an uncanny degree, allowing him to see Black*Star's running shadow in the smoke. He grinned and leaned down, effortlessly grabbing the ninja in his huge fingers. Despite the fact that Black*Star could take residence inside one of Soul's toes, Soul was able to hold him with an infinite care so as not to crush him. Along with increased senses he received an increase in the ability to control his body as well. Soul brought Black*Star up to his crimson eyes and smirked. "Just think...I used to be as small and pathetic as you!"

Soul laughed, his huge mouth opening, air rushing out and over Black*Star, the gigantic cavern taking up all of his sight. His eyes took it all in, the rows of razor sharp teeth, the glistening tongue that could so easily pin and subdue him, the dank, black hole of his throat, the pulsing fleshy walls of his inner cheeks and back of his throat, the dangling uvula...it was like looking into the gates of Hell. Soul slammed the gate shut, his trademark grin filling Black*Star's view instead. "Now...you won't be needing THIS anymore!"

He plucked Tsubaki out of Black*Star's resisting hands. Black*Star screamed as he reached out for his partner, the sword turning back into a young woman as she was dangled over Soul's maw. "BLACK*STAAAAAR!"

"TSUBAKIIIII!"

*GULP!*

Black*Star's body shook with rage, sadness, and a twinge of fear as Soul dropped Tsubaki, screaming, onto his tongue and easily swallowed her whole. "Aah...friends make the best food!"

"SHUT UP! YOU DAMN MONSTER! I'LL KILL YOU!" Black*Star shouted, struggling in between Soul's fingers in a fruitless attempt to escape. Soul laughed mockingly and held Black*Star up to his eyes again. "Settle down you little spaz. You're not doing anything except being the sole witness to the birth of a new god! So just sit back and enjoy the ride....or I might forget where you are and "accidentally" mix you in with a bunch of my snacks."

Black*Star glared up at Soul but didn't say a word. The only reason he didn't say anything was because if he stayed close to Soul he'd have a better chance of finding some weakness, ANY weakness, to take down the towering weapon. Unfortunately for Black*Star, Soul HAD no outstanding weakness any more. The only way to take him down would be finding the book that did this to him...and even then there was no guarantee of a cure! Soul rubbed his crotch a little and said, "Man...I'm starting to feel pretty active down there..."

He grinned at Black*Star and said, "Found your new carrying case!"

"What? NO! You've gotta be kidding!" Black*Star shouted, the fingers now holding the back of his shirt. Soul pulled open the waistband of his pants and briefs and said, "Relax, I showered today. Have fun down there!"

Without further ado, he dropped Black*Star into his pants, the tiny assassin screaming all the way down before he landed in the field of white hair. Soul snickered and let the band go, snapping it against his waist as he felt a familiar surge of energy. "Ah...growing again!"

Soul waited happily for the change and was disappointed as he only grew slightly larger, his body adding MAYBE a story or two to his height. It was barely noticeable. "Man...Tsubaki turned out to be a total dud! Totally uncool."

He kicked a building over sullenly, looking around for more food. His belly was already starting to rumble. He started wandering back toward his house to see if he missed anything over there...

"Any luck yet?" Stein shouted out from atop the rubble, his lab coat tossed aside as he searched.

"Nothing yet sir!" various people shouted from all over the wreckage.

"Alright! Remember, keep a look out for anything that looks remotely like a book, paper, or anything that has writing on it! The book might have been destroyed in the wreckage!" Stein ordered. "Yessir!" came the reply.

"Sir! Bad news!"

"Oh what is it now?" Stein asked.

"Soul has been spotted in the area! He's coming this way!"

"Alright people you know the drill! Get ready to fight Soul if it comes to that, but try to avoid conflict if possible! For now, hide!"

Everyone scattered, hiding themselves amongst the rubble as Soul's hulking frame appeared over the hill. His massive foot landed directly in front of them, his big toe inches from Stein's hiding place. "Huh..." Soul said, his voice rumbling intensely over them. "Looks like most of the city is abandoned... I can't believe I used to live here!"

Soul laughed and lifted up his foot, preparing to stomp it down on his once spacious apartment.

As the foot descended, Stein and his group broke from their hiding spots and ran to avoid it. Soul laughed even harder and put his foot down away from the wreckage. "I thought some ants might be hiding out!" Soul cracked his knuckles. "Time for some more fun!"
1321111211112111121112122211221.title: Total Failure

choices: Spirit and Stein duke it out with Soul.
13211112111121111211121222112211.content:
Soul watched with amusement as a large group of bugs tried to surround his feet. His feet were so massive, however, that the group could barely surround half of one foot without spreading out too much. Soul observed closer and noticed all the people wore similar clothing and were carrying guns. Soul’s smile started to fade as he realized they were all just humans…

“Damn it, just a bunch of human bugs employed by Shibusen.” Soul sighed as he put his hands in his pockets. “I don’t need your pathetic souls anymore, but I guess I can have some fun crushing all you!” Soul snickered as he got ready to lay waste to the foolish scout group. Before he could take the first step, he noticed someone odd in the group. One figure stood out from the rest and, although he was like an ant to Soul, he could make out that familiar screw in his head. “No way…Professor Stein?!” Soul’s red eyes seemed to gleam as he squatted down to get a closer look at the tiny meister. “I can’t believe you’d come out here! Shibusen should of just served you to me on a silver platter!”

“Soul, stop all of this!” Franken Stein shouted up at the smiling giant. “Has madness completely consumed you?”

“Madness?” Soul blinked for a moment before erupting into laughter. “Hahaha, no! This isn’t the power of madness; it’s my own raw power!” Soul demonstrated this flexing his left bicep, showing off its peak and all the natural power that was contained within. “I’m not insane or anything. I’m the bigger one, so it’s only right I act like it! You wouldn’t care of you squashed a bug in your lab, would you?”

“Soul…! What you did to Harvard and Ox…only someone consumed by madness would betray their own friends.”

“Friends? Those two? Don’t make me laugh…now Maka, SHE was a friend. And a tasty one too.” Soul licked his lips as he rubbed his stomach, remembering how good it had felt when he ate his former meister.

“Y-You…ate Maka?! You ate your own partner?!” Stein clenched his fists with rage, but Soul’s expression didn’t change in the slightest.

“Yup, and now I’m going to eat you!” Soul boomed as he thrust his hand toward the Shibusen teacher. Stein was more than fast enough to dodge the hand, jumping out of the way as it crashed into the ground. When the giant removed his hand he saw a bunch of debris, several mangled humans, but no Stein. “Missed…” Soul clenched his fist, crushing the everything in it to dust. He started scanning the ground again for Stein, but his vision became obstructed when a bunch of flashing lights exploded in his eyes. Soul put a hand up to his eyes and glanced down to see several scouts firing lasers at his face. “Little pests…” Soul muttered as he stood up to his full height and raised one of his feet over the group. He brought it down slowly, but it as so massive that the puny humans could never hope to avoid it. The white haired giant pressed his foot into the ground and felt several pops under his sole. He swiveled is foot back and forth, smearing them into nothingness. The other human employees watched as Soul raised his foot again, revealing a mess of debris stuck to the bottom. The smashed remains of their comrades were no where to be found, however. It was like they never even existed…

“Who’s next?” Soul asked as he shifted his foot, overtaking several more humans without noticing. He scanned the ground for more ants, especially Stein. A few were hiding behind the towering titan, debating on whether or not to flee or stay and die like their comrades. Suddenly, Stein jumped out of his hiding spot and cracked his fingers, his soul wavelength surging around them. Soul noticed Stein, but only after he had thrust his palms into his big toe.

“Soul Menace!” the powerful meister cried as he forced his power into Soul’s flesh. The amount of power he had used would of torn Soul apart at normal size, but now it only felt like the giant had stubbed his toe on something.

“Ouch!” Soul yelped as he took a step back, crushing those humans that were hiding. He brought his foot up to his chest and started rubbing his toe. His crimson eyes glared down at Stein, who glared right back up at him. “You’re going to pay for that, ant! Don’t blame me if I crush your legs or something; I just need you alive before I consume your soul!” Soul reared his fist back and threw it at his former teacher. Once again Stein jumped over the fist long before it reached the ground. Soul was expecting this, however, and delivered a jab to Stein while he was in mid air. The scientist crashed into a nearby building, prompting Soul to reach in after him and take out his dazed form. “Gotcha!”

Soul brought his fist up to his face and plucked the ant-sized Stein out of it. The most powerful meister in Shibusen was now held between two fingers before a massive red eye. Soul’s booming laughter filled his ears as he was brought closer to that mouth. The titan opened his mouth and licked over his shark-like teeth. The pearly whites glistened with perfection, capable of cutting through even diamond.

“I can feel it…your soul is going to make me HUGE, professor!” Soul giggled happily as he thought about how he should consume Stein. Toss him into the air and catch him? Lick him off his palm? Just pop him right in? This was a special moment, after all. Maka’s soul was nothing compared to what Stein’s was going to do for him. He might even tower over Shibusen!

“Bye, teach! I’d say it was nice knowing you, but I’d be lying.” Soul chuckled darkly before opening his jaws wide and getting ready to drop Stein in.

“Hey kid.”

“Eh?” Soul froze for a moment and glanced around. Did he just hear someone call him kid?

“You’ve gotten pretty big…”

“Who’s there?” Soul closed his mouth and looked around for whoever was talking to him. That voice…it sounded familiar. Soul scanned over the ground and the building tops, but all he found were a few leftover humans crawling away. Then he realized…the voice sounded like it was coming from right next to him. Could it be from…

Before Soul could finish his thoughts, he felt something slice into his ear. The giant’s eyes widened and he howled in pain. He brought his hands up to his ear (dropping Stein in the process) and covered the wound. His eyes were full of loathing now as he looked down to where Stein had landed and saw another figure land next to him. The figure was male, had red hair, and part of his elbow was transformed into a black scythe. The man glared up at Soul with two emerald eyes and the look showing he desired but one thing: Soul’s head.

“Spirit…” Stein muttered, catching his breath after his near death experience.

“The most powerful meister and the most powerful weapon…” Soul, despite his injury, grinned wide. “I guess snack time’s over! Time for the main course!”
13211112111121111211121222112211.title: Make Way For the Big Boy(s)

choices: Soul grows and grows and GROWS!
132111121111211112111212221122111.content:
Soul lowered his body slightly into a defensive posture, not taking Stein and Soul as lightly as he had Maka, Tsubaki and Black*Star. They were just as tiny but they were capable of putting up more of a fight. They had both, separately, already caused him mild pain and discomfort and, compared to every single other human being that had attempted to attack the god like Soul, that was quite an accomplishment. They were even more dangerous together. His crimson eyes watched as they darted back and forth, making use of the rubble around them to make sure that Soul couldn't get a clear view, moving so fast across the land it looked like they were appearing and disappearing at will. Soul chuckled, amused at their antics. To him, this was still just a simple game. To Stein and his weapon...it was a life or death struggle to survive.

Soul kept his defensive position for a few minutes, but when Stein refused to actually ATTACK him he slowly stood back up to his full height and rubbed the back of his head, his muscular arm ripping his sleeves more from the simple movement. "Man...you guys are too boring! At least Black*Star tried something."

He stepped forward and suddenly fell to his knee, the ground cracking, splitting apart, and shaking as the full weight of the massive weapon hit the ground. Stein barely managed to leap into the air to avoid the tremors, though he had to raise Spirit equally as fast since Soul's fist suddenly fired at him with the force of a thousand cannons. Stein grunted as he tried to hold Soul back, but was unable, his body traveling swiftly through the air. Within a few seconds he would crash into the ground with nearly lethal force if he didn't do something...FAST! Using Spirit, the meister managed to hook the weapon between two of Soul's fingers, swinging underneath his fist, stabbing Soul in the arm and dragging a huge gash along it, slowing his descent until he crashed lightly on his feet onto the ground. Soul bellowed in rage, grabbing his arm. They had cut deeper than he thought they could! Blood spattered on the ground as he rose back up to his full height. This wasn't a game anymore.

Thanks to Stein and Spirit's soul resonance, they were perfectly in tune fighting Soul, increasing their power enough to do significant damage to the so called god. Soul ripped off his sleeves, revealing his thick arms, tying the material around his arm to keep the blood from flowing. "Alright you little bugs! That's it! No more Mr. Nice Guy!"

Soul lifted up his foot and slammed it, hard, into the ground, causing it to shake and warp even more than before, buildings and streets alike falling into the crevices as the ground split open. This made things even more difficult for Stein to move around in. Several holes and chasms were littered across the landscape, forcing him to constantly jump around to make any distance. Soul watched his movements carefully, then, as Stein leaped over a particularly large chasm, he lifted his foot up and slammed it down on top of him. Stein was slightly slower this time, his left leg getting caught by the massive foot before he could fully dodge. He gritted his teeth, trying to avoid screaming in pain as his leg was shattered. Lifting up Spirit, he stabbed Soul, deep into his foot, causing Soul to jerk his foot back up, launching the professor into the air and up towards Soul's face. Soul moved on pure instinct, bringing his hands up and slamming them together like he was swatting a bug. Stein was prepared for this and turned Spirit side ways, stopping the killing hands inches from his body. Gathering his energy into his hands, he slammed one against each of Soul's palms and shouted, "Soul Menace!"

What felt like two bee stings slammed into Soul's hands, forcing them apart, Stein grabbing Spirit again and aiming a slash at Soul's chest. Soul jerked his body back and to the side, the scythe's blade only managing to rip his jacket slightly. Growling in anger, Soul slammed his fist against Stein again, moving faster than the teacher could deal with, Stein only managing to clear his whole body except for his left arm which was promptly smashed against a building and Soul's enormous fist. Stein crumpled to the ground, half of his body maimed and worthless. Using Spirit as a crutch he managed to get to his feet, though his options were now severely limited. Before he could even begin to move, Soul's massive feet appeared on either side of him, the gigantic teen lowering himself so he was crouching over his former teacher. "You're lucky I need you alive teach. Otherwise you would have already been dead!"

He changed one of his arms into a blade and said, "See? I could have sliced you up before you knew it was coming!" His arm turned back to normal and he reached down snatching Stein by his unbroken arm. Using the finesse he recently gained from his new senses, he crushed the man's arm, forcing him to drop Spirit, whom Soul swiftly snatched up. He held each man in a different fist, bringing them both up to his huge face. "You two definitely put up a good fight! But now you're going to give me the biggest spurt I've had yet! See Shibusen over there? Thanks to you two, I'll be able to take it on with ease! Thanks a lot!"

He laughed and tossed Spirit into mouth first, slathering the weapon in saliva before gulping him down. Soul sighed and turned his attention to Stein. "Now you!"

He didn't have to worry about Stein fighting back anymore so he took his time. He held the broken man in his palm and slowly stuck his tongue out, running it all over Stein's body. When he had fully appreciated the man's unusual taste, he licked him up into his hot, steamy mouth, running him over the sides of his razor sharp teeth, coating him in so much saliva he couldn't move. With a practiced flick, he was launched into the air, bumped into the uvula, and dropped down, down, down the dark, slimy throat. Soul burped a little and looked around, eager to see how huge he was about to get!
132111121111211112111212221122111.title: Battle for the Ages

choices: Soul uses his size to toy with Black Star.
Looks like everyone has forgotten you...or have they?
1321111211112111121112122211221111.content:
Soul could feel the two men struggle against his digestive system. Despite their beaten and worn bodies, they still put up a fight, but in the end they were just delaying the inevitable. The struggles ceased as their physical forms were broken down like everyone else and their mighty souls fused with Soul. The albino titan planted his feet firmly on the ground as he felt newfound power build up in the middle of his stomach. He closed his eyes and grinned as the power exploded outward like a bomb, wiping out everything around Soul like an invisible hand. Buildings that once stood around Soul’s feet simply vanished; Soul now stood in a circular area of dirt and debris. It wasn’t over yet; a second burst of unfathomable power came from Soul and buried into the ground, creating a sizable crater right there in Death City. Then came the growing…

Soul licked his lips as he watched his point of view get higher and higher. His feet started filling the crater he had formed as he grew like never before. Any people that had somehow survived watched their new god ascend even higher. Those that thought Soul couldn’t get any bigger and scarier were proven horribly, horribly wrong. None of them ran, however. There was no way they could escape someone so huge now; they wouldn’t be safe anywhere in the city…and soon the entire world.

“I used to think this city was big,” Soul said to himself in a loud, booming voice. The growing god stepped out of the crater, his barefoot slamming into the city and causing the ground to explode under his heavy power. The other foot caused equal destruction as several miles of civilization was wiped out in an instant. “But it’s really pathetically small!” Soul laughed as he looked down on his former home. The god turned his attention to his jacket as his growing muscled made mincemeat out of it. His favorite jacket started falling to the ground below, but Soul felt no sadness over it. The perfect abs and mountain sized pecs that became fully visible when the last of it disappeared was Soul’s new fashion. His god-like body would have been perfect if it wasn’t for that scar across his chest, but oh well. Soul always did think the scar was cool…it just made his hulking form more sexier.

“Hehe, poor Black Star,” Soul chuckled as he flexed his bicep. The makeshift bandage he had previously made popped off as he did this, revealing that the wound Stein had just given him was already closing up thanks to the mad doctor’s own soul. “He spent his entire life shaping his body and I’ve surpassed it in every way after just a few hours of stuffing my face!”

Speaking of Black Star, Soul only remembered the blue haired meister when he felt his dark red pants getting uncomfortably tight around his thighs. “Oops…better get him before he’s crushed!” Soul dug his hand into his shrinking pocket, tearing it open as he did, and enclosed his small prisoner in his fist. He brought the fist up to his young face and opened it. There, in the middle of his palm, was the ant-sized Black Star. The ninja still looked broken over the death of his partner, but he could still acknowledge the growing palm around him and the sinister red eye that was staring at him. He shivered in fright as Soul moved his palm a little away from his face, allowing his former friend to see the entirety of his face.

“What do you think, Mr. Big Man?” Soul asked as he watched Black Star shrink in his palm, just as he said he would. “I’m bigger than Shibusen now!”

Black Star’s mouth quivered at the sight and sheer power Soul was emitting. He was nothing but an ant to the weapon now…he had no choice but to admit that! There was no opportunity for his cocky, big ego to show itself here. Black Star had only one thing to say right now…

“W-What are you going to do now?”

“Hmm?” Soul titled his massive head a bit and smiled amusingly. His crimson eyes glanced over at Shibusen, which the white haired weapon could now look down at no matter where he stood in the city. His eyes fell back onto Black Star. “Worried about the rest of your comrades? Don’t be…they’ll all end up in my stomach too, along with the other Death Scythes and even Shinigami himself! There’s nothing you can do about it, so just accept it.”

Black Star gritted his teeth. He didn’t want to accept that, but the way thinks looked…it was the only likely conclusion. Shibusen hasn’t made any attempts to evacuate and it’s too late to start them. If the most powerful Death Scythe was defeated, what chance did the others have? There was still Shinigami-sama…but did he even stand a chance now?

As Black Star worried about he fates of his comrades, Soul was thinking about more important things: like his pants. They now looked like a shredded pair of shorts and they were hugging around his muscled thighs. They’d eventually tear off, but Soul couldn’t wait nay long. He gripped the fabric and tore it off with ease, tossing the ragged clothing aside. The only thing Soul wore now was a pair of blue boxers with bones all over them. They were surprisingly keeping up with his growth…for now…

“Anyway, I can go and devour Shibusen any time I want. How about I have a little fun first?” Soul grinned evilly at Black Star. It was time to make the BIG Black Star feel really SMALL.
1321111211112111121112122211221111.title: Soul grows and grows and GROWS!

choices: Soul tortures Black*Star with his other muscles
Soul moves on to the main event
13211112111121111211121222112211111.content:
Soul just couldn't get over how huge he had become...and this wasn't even the end of his size increase! So long as he had souls to eat, he'd keep right on growing. And when the souls ran out? Well there was always...other hungers he could satisfy. Speaking of which..

He looked down passed his palm and saw his tight boxers growing tighter. His sheer size, the power he exuded over Black*Star and the entire city, and the knowledge that no one could ever hope to stop him, was starting to get him VERY excited. Surely nothing would make Black*Star feel smaller than being forced to crawl over his dick like a truly tiny pest, trying to get him off...his cock head gently poked through the hole in front of the boxers, slowly revealing more and more of itself as Soul's thoughts continued down this line. But that would come in time. There was no reason not to ride these feelings for awhile. He had all the time in the world.

"Alright Black*Star, first I'm going to give you a new name! Black*Star is the name of the man who will surpass god right? Well, now that I'M god, there's no way you'll ever be able to surpass me, so you don't deserve that name anymore. Instead, I'm going to call you...Bug*Star. Heh, at least I'll call you that until you get too small to even be a bug."

Black*Star felt his cheeks burn with humiliation. It wasn't bad enough he was completely at the mercy of a monster like Soul? Now the giant weapon had to reduce even his humanity? And broadcast it to everyone who was still alive in Death City? Talk about torture...unfortunately, the meister had no IDEA what torture really was.

"Hey! Are you listening? Answer your god!" Soul bellowed, his voice blasting over Black*Star's body, the power of it filling his body and making it shake from the sheer force. Black*Star trembled uncontrollably, falling to his knees. Soul laughed and said, in a quieter voice, "How pathetic. Do you know how totally uncool you look right now?"

Black*Star got to his feet again, his face looking slightly sweaty as he muttered, "W-What do you want me to say?"

Soul, thanks to his enhanced sense, heard Black*Star clear as a bell. "I want you to say you're grateful for your new name."

Black*Star looked almost defiantly up at Soul. "Thanks for my new name."

Soul sighed and rolled his eyes. "You can do better than that. Say "Thanks so much for my new name Soul-sama."

Black*Star visibly spit on Soul's palm and said, "Like hell I will! I don't care how much bigger you are than me! I'm not going to lay down and just take your abuse!"

Soul stared at Black*Star for a moment before snorting and laughing at the bug like man's defiance. "I should have known you'd say something like that. You never were very smart."

He snatched Black*Star up between his fingers and lifted him up in front of his face. "Maybe I should just eat you now after all..."

He stuck his tongue out and licked all over Black*Star's body, a musky, manly taste lingering on Black*Star's skin. "You ARE pretty tasty..."

Black*Star felt a thrill of fear run through his body. Soul said he wasn't going to eat him! That's one of the reasons he felt so safe being defiant! This wasn't supposed to happen! Soul lifted Black*Star up over his head, his mouth opening wide. "Well...bottoms up!"

"NO! NO! PLEASE DON'T EAT ME!" Black*Star shouted out in panic. "THANK YOU SOUL-SAMA FOR THE NEW NAME!"

Soul gripped Black*Star in his fist, grinning down at him. "Hah! I knew that would work! You really too dumb to live!"

Black*Star's fear was slowly replaced by rage. He struggled to escape, his face pressing against one of Soul's fingers, trying to bite it, to do ANY kind of damage to Soul's body, but failing. Seeing the bug struggle only fueled Soul's erection. "Mmm....I'm getting pretty excited about all this you know."

Black*Star immediately stopped struggling, looking horrified. Soul grinned and said, "Don't worry you won't be going down there...yet."

He brought Black*Star closer to his chest and said, "First things first. Let's see what's stronger, Bug*Star or God's Pecs."

Before Black*Star could question what Soul meant, the hand opened up and he felt his body getting pressed tight against the palm as it rushed toward the living wall of Soul's chest.
